analyzed: snang na yang gzhan du snang ba de dag las gzhan du @258b de tshogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Even if it were perceived, it would not be a collection of those things that are perceived as different.

original: de lta yin pa nyid na yang /
analyzed: de lta yin pa nyid na yang /
translated: Even if that were so,

original: de dag nyid phan tshun ltos nas tshogs pa'i tha snyad brten par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de dag nyid phan tshun ltos nas tshogs pa'i tha snyad brten par 'gyur gyi /
translated: the convention of a collection would be based on those things in mutual dependence.

original: gzhan gyis ci bya /
analyzed: gzhan gyis ci bya /
translated: What would be the point of anything else?

original: 'on te de dag gi rang bzhin mi snang bar gyur nas /
analyzed: 'on te de dag gi rang bzhin mi snang bar gyur nas /
translated: But if the nature of those things is not perceived,

original: gzhan gyi rang bzhin snang ngo zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rang bzhin snang ngo zhe na /
translated: and the nature of something else is perceived,

original: de yang dngos po la de lta bu med pa'i lhag par sgro btags pa tsam yin pas ji ltar rtogs pa med pa'i yul yin /
analyzed: de yang dngos po la de lta bu med pa'i lhag par sgro btags pa tsam yin pas ji ltar rtogs pa med pa'i yul yin /
translated: then that is just an imaginative construction of something that does not exist in things. How can it be the object of a non-imaginative cognition?

original: btags pa'i yul can nyid ni rtog pa dang bcas pa bzlog par dka'o zhe na /
analyzed: btags pa'i yul can nyid ni rtog pa dang bcas pa bzlog par dka'o zhe na /
translated: But the subject that is designated is associated with thought, and so is difficult to stop.

original: 'di la lan //
analyzed: 'di la lan //
translated: The answer to this is:

original: don gzhan dang ni mngon 'brel phyir //
analyzed: don gzhan dang ni mngon 'brel phyir //
translated: Because it is associated with another object,

original: rdul phran gzhan gang skye 'gyur ba //
analyzed: rdul phran gzhan gang skye 'gyur ba //
translated: the atom that is born is different.

original: de dag bas gas bshad de dag ni //
analyzed: de dag bas gas bshad de dag ni //
translated: Those atoms that are different

original: shes pa skye ba'i rgyu mtshan yin //
analyzed: shes pa skye ba'i rgyu mtshan yin //
translated: are the causes for the production of consciousness.

original: rdul phran gzhan dag med par ni //
analyzed: rdul phran gzhan dag med par ni //
translated: Without other atoms,

original: rdul phran khyad par de yang med //
analyzed: rdul phran khyad par de yang med //
translated: that difference in the atom would not exist.

original: shes te gcig las nges min phyir //
analyzed: shes te gcig las nges min phyir //
translated: It is known that it is not definite from one,

original: spyi yi spyod yul can du bshad //
analyzed: spyi yi spyod yul can du bshad //
translated: and so it is explained as having a universal for its object.

original: gzhan las shes pa'i rgyu'i nus pa ma skyes pa'i rdul phra rab de dag ni phra ba ma yin pa mthong ba rnams kyi shes pa skyed par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan las shes pa'i rgyu'i nus pa ma skyes pa'i rdul phra rab de dag ni phra ba ma yin pa mthong ba rnams kyi shes pa skyed par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Those subtle atoms, the causes for the production of consciousness, which have not yet produced a consciousness, are not able to produce the consciousness of those who see the non-subtle.

original: des na thams cad kyi shes pa bskyed par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: des na thams cad kyi shes pa bskyed par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are able to produce the consciousness of all.

original: shes pa de ni gcig la nges pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shes pa de ni gcig la nges pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: And that consciousness is not definite from one,

original: spyi'i yul can du bshad do //
analyzed: spyi'i yul can du bshad do //
translated: and so it is explained as having a universal for its object.

original: phan tshun tha dad pa nyid du ci'i phyir mi snang zhe na /
analyzed: phan tshun tha dad pa nyid du ci'i phyir mi snang zhe na /
translated: Why don‚Äôt they appear as mutually distinct?

original: skra la sogs pa ma 'dres pa rnams kyang thag ring po nas ma 'dres pa nyid du snang ba'i spyod yul du 'gyur ram /
analyzed: skra la sogs pa ma 'dres pa rnams kyang thag ring po nas ma 'dres pa nyid du snang ba'i spyod yul du 'gyur ram /
translated: Even unmixed things such as hairs and so on are the objects of the field of experience of unmixed appearances from a distance.

original: des na gal te rang gi rgyud las rang gi rnam par gtod pa'i nus pa med pa nyid du nges pa'i phyir mi snang ba yin na /
analyzed: des na gal te rang gi rgyud las rang gi rnam par gtod pa'i nus pa med pa nyid du nges pa'i phyir mi snang ba yin na /
translated: Therefore, if it is certain that the capacity to cast its own aspect from its own continuum does not exist, then it does not appear.

original: 'di la klan ka ci yod /
analyzed: 'di la klan ka ci yod /
translated: What is the problem with that?

original: 'o na mngon sum la dngos po'i de kho na mi snang ba'i phyir 'khrul pa nyid du 'gyur ro /
analyzed: 'o na mngon sum la dngos po'i de kho na mi snang ba'i phyir 'khrul pa nyid du 'gyur ro /
translated: But since the reality of things does not appear to direct perception, it would be mistaken.

original: lhag par sgro btags pa'i rang bzhin snang ba ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: lhag par sgro btags pa'i rang bzhin snang ba ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas par 'gyur te /
translated: The appearance of the nature of the superimposed object would be conceptual,

original: spyi'i rnam par rtog pa gzhan bzhin no //üîΩ'on te der blo'i rang bzhin nyid rags pa /
analyzed: spyi'i rnam par rtog pa gzhan bzhin no // 'on te der blo'i rang bzhin nyid rags pa /
translated: like any other conceptual cognition.

original: ling ling po gcig gi rnam par mngon du byas par snang ba des na rtog pa med pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: ling ling po gcig gi rnam par mngon du byas par snang ba des na rtog pa med pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: But if the nature of the mind itself appears as a single, vivid, coarse object, then it is not conceptual.

original: da ni rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid chad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: da ni rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid chad par 'gyur te /
translated: Now, the very presence of thought will be cut off,

original: rtog pa'i shes pa thams cad la blo'i rang bzhin nyid snang ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rtog pa'i shes pa thams cad la blo'i rang bzhin nyid snang ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because the nature of the mind appears in all cognitions that have thoughts.

original: 'di la brjod pa /
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa /
translated: To this we reply:

original: da lta'i skye bo la ltos nas //
analyzed: da lta'i skye bo la ltos nas //
translated: In relation to the present people,

original: gnod byed shes pa med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gnod byed shes pa med pa'i phyir //
translated: because there is no cognition that is not impaired,

original: ma 'khrul par bshad don dam du //
analyzed: ma 'khrul par bshad don dam du //
translated: it is explained as non-erroneous.

original: dmigs pa thams cad 'khrul pa nyid //
analyzed: dmigs pa thams cad 'khrul pa nyid //
translated: All objects of cognition are indeed erroneous.

original: da ltar gyi skye bo rtogs pa'i snang ba ma shes pa rnams la 'di ma 'khrul pa nyid du snang bas /
analyzed: da ltar gyi skye bo rtogs pa'i snang ba ma shes pa rnams la 'di ma 'khrul pa nyid du snang bas /
translated: For those present people who do not understand the appearance of conceptual cognition, it appears as non-erroneous.

original: de la ltos nas ma 'khrul pa yin no zhes de skad bshad par gyi /üîΩdon dam par ni dmigs @259a * //
analyzed: de la ltos nas ma 'khrul pa yin no zhes de skad bshad par gyi / don dam par ni dmigs @259a * //
translated: In relation to that, it is explained as non-erroneous.

original: pa thams cad la 'khrul pa kho na'o //
analyzed: pa thams cad la 'khrul pa kho na'o //
translated: But ultimately, all objects of cognition are indeed erroneous.

original: gang gi phyir mngon du byed pa'i rang bzhin gyis /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mngon du byed pa'i rang bzhin gyis /
translated: Because of the nature of manifestation,üîΩit is said that direct perception

original: 'dzin pa la ni mngon phyogs pa'i //üîΩmngon sum la ni de skad du //
analyzed: 'dzin pa la ni mngon phyogs pa'i // mngon sum la ni de skad du //
translated: is directed towards grasping.

original: rnam rtog bcas pa de mi brjod //
analyzed: rnam rtog bcas pa de mi brjod //
translated: In that, conceptual cognition is not expressed.

original: mngon du byed pa ni rtog pa dang bcas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon du byed pa ni rtog pa dang bcas pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not associated with conceptualization.

original: rtogs pas ni snga ma dang phyi mar mthong ba'i don lhag par zhen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs pas ni snga ma dang phyi mar mthong ba'i don lhag par zhen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For conceptualization is the adherence to the meaning of what is seen previously and subsequently.

original: mngon sum du byed pa nyid ni lhag par zhen pa zhes brjod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum du byed pa nyid ni lhag par zhen pa zhes brjod pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not said that the object of direct perception is adherence.

original: de nyid ni de las bzlog pa la grags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid ni de las bzlog pa la grags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For that is well known to be the opposite of that.

original: 'o na de lta na ni spyi'i spyod yul med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na de lta na ni spyi'i spyod yul med par 'gyur te /
translated: If that is so, then the object of direct perception would not exist,

original: de ni 'jig rten gyi grags pas rang gi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni 'jig rten gyi grags pas rang gi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is well known in the world that the object of direct perception is a particular.

original: 'di dag ni skye mched kyi rang gi mtshan nyid la ltos nas rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di dag ni skye mched kyi rang gi mtshan nyid la ltos nas rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can yin gyi /
translated: It is said that these are objects of direct perception in terms of the particular of the sense base,

original: rdzas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ni ma yin no zhes bshad do zhe na /
analyzed: rdzas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ni ma yin no zhes bshad do zhe na /
translated: but not in terms of the particular of substance.

original: de yang mi bden te /
analyzed: de yang mi bden te /
translated: That is not correct.

original: rnam dbye 'di ni don dam la //
analyzed: rnam dbye 'di ni don dam la //
translated: This classificationüîΩwas made by the former masters

original: dgongs nas sngon gyi slob dpon gyis //üîΩbtags yin de yi phyir na spyi //
analyzed: dgongs nas sngon gyi slob dpon gyis // btags yin de yi phyir na spyi //
translated: with the ultimate in mind.

original: spyod yul yin bar 'gal ba med //
analyzed: spyod yul yin bar 'gal ba med //
translated: Therefore, it is not contradictory for the object of direct perception to be a universal.

original: de ltar gzung ba'i rdul phra rab nyid spyi yin no //
analyzed: de ltar gzung ba'i rdul phra rab nyid spyi yin no //
translated: Thus, the subtle atom as the object is the universal.

original: gang yang thams cad rtog pa med pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa de la yang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gang yang thams cad rtog pa med pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa de la yang brjod par bya ste /
translated: And as for the objection that all cognition would be non-determinate, we reply:

original: tshad mas rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: tshad mas rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is apprehended by valid cognition,

original: 'di ni 'dod pa nyid 'ongs so //üîΩgzhan la grags pa la brten nas //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dod pa nyid 'ongs so // gzhan la grags pa la brten nas //
translated: this is just what we accept.üîΩThe author of the treatise has distinguished

original: bstan bcos mdzad pas rnam dbye gsungs //
analyzed: bstan bcos mdzad pas rnam dbye gsungs //
translated: between the two on the basis of what is well known to others.

original: spyod pa la sogs pa gzhan la rab tu grags pa la brten nas rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa nyid du bstan gyi /
analyzed: spyod pa la sogs pa gzhan la rab tu grags pa la brten nas rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa nyid du bstan gyi /
translated: The author of the treatise has distinguished between the two on the basis of what is well known to others, namely, that the conceptual cognition is a memory, while the non-conceptual cognition is not.

original: mngon du byed pa la ni de med pa'i phyir na rnam par rtog pa can dang / cig shos kyi rnam par dbye ba ni bstan bcos mdzad pa dag gis mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon du byed pa la ni de med pa'i phyir na rnam par rtog pa can dang / cig shos kyi rnam par dbye ba ni bstan bcos mdzad pa dag gis mdzad pa yin no //
translated: The distinction between the conceptual and the non-conceptual is made by the authors of the treatises, because the latter is not manifest.

original: gal te skye mched gcig yin yang //
analyzed: gal te skye mched gcig yin yang //
translated: Even though there is only one sense-faculty,

original: cig car du mar 'dzin pa yin //
analyzed: cig car du mar 'dzin pa yin //
translated: there is the apprehension of many at one time.

original: de yi phyir na sngar bzung don //
analyzed: de yi phyir na sngar bzung don //
translated: Therefore, the object previously apprehended

original: sgro 'dogs phyir na rtog bcas yin //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs phyir na rtog bcas yin //
translated: is conceptual because it is reified.

original: rdul phra rab du ma cig car 'dzin na ni sngar bzung ba sgro 'dogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rdul phra rab du ma cig car 'dzin na ni sngar bzung ba sgro 'dogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: If many atoms are apprehended simultaneously, then the previous apprehension is not superceded.

original: rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pas rnam par rtog pa dang bcas par mi 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pas rnam par rtog pa dang bcas par mi 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: And if the subsequent memory-conceptualization does not conceptualize,

original: rim gyis 'dzin pa la ni bzlog par dka'o //
analyzed: rim gyis 'dzin pa la ni bzlog par dka'o //
translated: then it is difficult to reverse the apprehension of them in sequence.

original: shes pa gcig gis ni dus gcig tu du ma 'dzin par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa gcig gis ni dus gcig tu du ma 'dzin par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: One cognition cannot apprehend many things simultaneously,

original: gcig la yid 'brel par gyur pa na gzhan la de nyid kyi tshe byed par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig la yid 'brel par gyur pa na gzhan la de nyid kyi tshe byed par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because when the mind is related to one thing, it is not logical that it is related to another at the same time.

original: yang na ni dus gcig tu bzung ba'i phyir yan lag can gyi rdzas gcig khas blang bar bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: yang na ni dus gcig tu bzung ba'i phyir yan lag can gyi rdzas gcig khas blang bar bya'o zhe na /
translated: Or else, because they are apprehended simultaneously, you must accept that they are one substantial entity.

original: du ma gcig gis mi 'dzin pa'am /
analyzed: du ma gcig gis mi 'dzin pa'am /
translated: But many are not apprehended by one,

original: de gcig pa @259b yang gang las yin //
analyzed: de gcig pa @259b yang gang las yin //
translated: and how could they be one?

original: til sogs tha dad la ji ltar //
analyzed: til sogs tha dad la ji ltar //
translated: How is it that different things such as sesame seeds

original: cig car 'dzin par snang ba yin //
analyzed: cig car 'dzin par snang ba yin //
translated: are simultaneously apprehended?

original: gal te rdul phra rab dag cig car 'dzin pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te rdul phra rab dag cig car 'dzin pa ma yin na /
translated: If many atoms are not simultaneously apprehended,

original: de lta na ni snga ma sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir kho bo cag rnam par rtog pa dang bcas par 'dod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta na ni snga ma sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir kho bo cag rnam par rtog pa dang bcas par 'dod pa nyid do //
translated: But if it does, then we admit that it is conceptual, because it superimposes a unity.

original: 'on te mthong ba yin na de lta na ni mngon du byed pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid grub po //
analyzed: 'on te mthong ba yin na de lta na ni mngon du byed pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid grub po //
translated: But if it does see, then it is established that it is non-conceptual, because it is a direct perception.

original: gzhan yang rung ba'i yul na gnas pa du ma gcig gis dus gcig tu mi 'dzin pa 'di cis grub /
analyzed: gzhan yang rung ba'i yul na gnas pa du ma gcig gis dus gcig tu mi 'dzin pa 'di cis grub /
translated: Moreover, how is it established that many people in the same place do not simultaneously apprehend it?

original: yid gcig yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: yid gcig yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because the mind is one.

original: yid ni rnam par shes pa'i cig car skyed pa 'gal bar ma grub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yid ni rnam par shes pa'i cig car skyed pa 'gal bar ma grub pa'i phyir te /
translated: But it is not established that the simultaneous generation of consciousnesses is contradictory,

original: yid nyid ni yid la byed pa tsam yin par grags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid nyid ni yid la byed pa tsam yin par grags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mind is well known to be merely the activity of the mind.

original: gzhan yang phan tshun ma 'dres pa'i til dang / 'bras dang / dbyig pa dang / ril ba dang / snod dang / rna rgyan la sogs pa dag la cig car 'dzin pa'i shes pa nyid ni rtogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan yang phan tshun ma 'dres pa'i til dang / 'bras dang / dbyig pa dang / ril ba dang / snod dang / rna rgyan la sogs pa dag la cig car 'dzin pa'i shes pa nyid ni rtogs pa nyid do //
translated: Moreover, the very consciousness that simultaneously apprehends sesame seeds, rice, gold, sticks, pots, earrings, etc., which are not mixed with each other, is conceptual.

original: myur ba'i phyir 'dzin pa cig car bar mngon pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: myur ba'i phyir 'dzin pa cig car bar mngon pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, because of speed, there is the appearance of simultaneous apprehension.

original: mi bden te /
analyzed: mi bden te /
translated: This is not correct.

original: 'di ltar 'di la mgyogs pa bshad zin to //üîΩrim bzhin 'byung ba de nyid la //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di la mgyogs pa bshad zin to // rim bzhin 'byung ba de nyid la //
translated: Because speed has already been explained,üîΩand because speed does not exist.üîΩHow can there be nonsequential apprehension

original: ji ltar rim min 'dzin mi 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar rim min 'dzin mi 'gyur //
translated: of that which arises in sequence?

original: blo rnams dag ni thams cad kyang //
analyzed: blo rnams dag ni thams cad kyang //
translated: And how can all cognitions

original: dus mtshungs ji ltar de dag la //
analyzed: dus mtshungs ji ltar de dag la //
translated: have the same time?üîΩHow can some appear sequentially

original: 'ga' zhig rim bzhin snang ba dang // gzhan ni rim ldan snang bar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig rim bzhin snang ba dang // gzhan ni rim ldan snang bar 'gyur //
translated: and others not?

original: de'i phyir don kun 'dzin pa la //
analyzed: de'i phyir don kun 'dzin pa la //
translated: Therefore, in the apprehension of all objects,

original: 'di ni rim min thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'di ni rim min thal bar 'gyur //
translated: this nonsequential appearance would follow.

original: mgyogs pa'i phyir ni cig car 'dzin par mi 'thad de /
analyzed: mgyogs pa'i phyir ni cig car 'dzin par mi 'thad de /
translated: Because of speed, simultaneous apprehension is not tenable,

original: bshad zin pa'i phyir na mgyogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad zin pa'i phyir na mgyogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because speed does not exist.

original: mgyogs pa'i phyir cig car ma bzung yang cig car gzung bar mngon par rlom pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las yin /
analyzed: mgyogs pa'i phyir cig car ma bzung yang cig car gzung bar mngon par rlom pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las yin /
translated: How can it be that because of speed, even though there is no simultaneous apprehension, there is the appearance of simultaneous apprehension?

original: autpala'i 'dab ma brgya phigs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: autpala'i 'dab ma brgya phigs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: It is like the appearance of the hundred petals of a lotus being simultaneously opened.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.

original: dpe tsam gyis don mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpe tsam gyis don mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the meaning is not established by mere example.

original: gcig la grub bas gzhan du yang de ltar 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gcig la grub bas gzhan du yang de ltar 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that when one is established, the other is also established.

original: blo 'og gi rim pa dang bcas pa'i 'dab ma brgya po dag phigs pa ni dus gcig tu phigs par mi srid pa'i phyir /
analyzed: blo 'og gi rim pa dang bcas pa'i 'dab ma brgya po dag phigs pa ni dus gcig tu phigs par mi srid pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is not possible to pierce a hundred petals of a lotus at once, with a single stroke,

original: rjes su dpag pas rim pa grub pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas rim pa grub pa yin no //
translated: the sequence is established by inference.

original: de ltar rtog na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba bzlog par nus pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar rtog na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba bzlog par nus pa yang ma yin no //
translated: If one conceives it in that way, it is not possible to avoid the absurd consequence.

original: de'i phyir gnod par byed pa med pas 'khrul par mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnod par byed pa med pas 'khrul par mi 'grub bo //
translated: Therefore, since there is no fault, error is not established.

original: gal te mgyogs pa'i phyir cig car 'dzin par rlom pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te mgyogs pa'i phyir cig car 'dzin par rlom pa yin na /
translated: If you assume that you apprehend them simultaneously because they are fast,

original: rim gyis 'bab pa de dag nyid la de ltar ci ste mi 'gyur /
analyzed: rim gyis 'bab pa de dag nyid la de ltar ci ste mi 'gyur /
translated: why don‚Äôt you think that about the falling drops of water?

original: mgyogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes na /üîΩ'di la yang de yod do zhes bya ba 'di ga las cig car 'dzin par rlom pa'i phyir ro @260a * //
analyzed: mgyogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes na / 'di la yang de yod do zhes bya ba 'di ga las cig car 'dzin par rlom pa'i phyir ro @260a * //
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúBecause they are not fast,‚ÄùüîΩwe say, ‚ÄúIn this case, how do you know that they exist?‚Äù

original: zhe na / de nyid kyang ga las yin te /
analyzed: zhe na / de nyid kyang ga las yin te /
translated: You assume that you apprehend them simultaneously.

original: phan tshun brten par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun brten par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they would be mutually dependent.

original: ji srid du cig car 'dzin pa 'khrul par ma grub pa de srid du ni mgyogs par mi 'grub la /
analyzed: ji srid du cig car 'dzin pa 'khrul par ma grub pa de srid du ni mgyogs par mi 'grub la /
translated: As long as the simultaneous apprehension is not established as erroneous, speed is not established.

original: ji srid du de ma grub pa de srid du yang 'khrul pa nyid du mi 'grub po //üîΩgzhan yang / skad cig nyid kyis blo rnams ni //
analyzed: ji srid du de ma grub pa de srid du yang 'khrul pa nyid du mi 'grub po // gzhan yang / skad cig nyid kyis blo rnams ni //
translated: And as long as that is not established, error itself is not established.üîΩMoreover,üîΩall cognitions are simultaneous

translated: how can one eliminate the other?üîΩIf they are not equal in strength, how can they be valid cognitions?üîΩBut if you say that the inference that is contradicted is not a valid cognition,

analyzed: gang zhig mngon sum dang 'gal ba de ni rjes su dpag pa nyid ma yin no zhes mtshungs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it follows, absurdly, that the inference that contradicts direct perception is not a valid cognition, for the reason is similar.

original: 'on te snang ba ni ci zhig ltar rgyu las nyes pa dang bcas par 'gyur gyi rjes su dpag pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te snang ba ni ci zhig ltar rgyu las nyes pa dang bcas par 'gyur gyi rjes su dpag pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But if you say that the appearance is faulty because of the cause, but the inference is not,

original: des na de nyid gnod par byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des na de nyid gnod par byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: then that very inference is what eliminates it.üîΩBut that is not good,

original: de yang legs pa ma yin te //
analyzed: de yang legs pa ma yin te //
translated: for

original: rgyu yi nyes pas gzhal bya'i blo //
analyzed: rgyu yi nyes pas gzhal bya'i blo //
translated: The cognition of the object is possible due to the fault of the cause.

original: gzhan du'ang srid ces rigs par ldan //
analyzed: gzhan du'ang srid ces rigs par ldan //
translated: It is logical that it is possible in another way.

original: ngo bo nyid la rgyu yi skyon //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid la rgyu yi skyon //
translated: The fault of the cause is in the intrinsic nature.

original: brgya phrag gis kyang ji ltar 'thad //
analyzed: brgya phrag gis kyang ji ltar 'thad //
translated: How is it tenable even in a hundred ways?

original: rim pa dang ldan par snang ba'i rang gi ngo bo ni rgyu'i nyes pas rim pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: rim pa dang ldan par snang ba'i rang gi ngo bo ni rgyu'i nyes pas rim pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar mi rigs so //
translated: It is not logical that the intrinsic nature that appears in a sequence would become without sequence due to the fault of the cause.

original: rang bzhin gcig la ni du ma yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gcig la ni du ma yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Many do not exist in a single intrinsic nature.

original: de ltar rtogs par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar rtogs par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that it would be cognized as such.

original: gcig mi snang ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gcig mi snang ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the single one does not appear,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that it would be without its own intrinsic nature.

original: mi snang ba snang ba yod do zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mi snang ba snang ba yod do zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that the nonappearance is the existence of appearance.

original: mi snang ba snang ba'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba ni 'thad par dka'o //
analyzed: mi snang ba snang ba'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba ni 'thad par dka'o //
translated: It is difficult to accept that the nonappearance is the intrinsic nature of appearance.

original: 'on te de la rim pa nyid snang ba yin gyi cig shos ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te de la rim pa nyid snang ba yin gyi cig shos ni ma yin te /
translated: If you say that the sequence itself appears in that and the other does not,

original: cig shos na 'khrul pa zad do zhe na 'khrul pa zhes bya ba ci zhig ci mi snang ba yin nam /
analyzed: cig shos na 'khrul pa zad do zhe na 'khrul pa zhes bya ba ci zhig ci mi snang ba yin nam /
translated: What is this so-called error? Is it the non-appearance of something?

original: rnam pa gzhan du snang ba yin //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du snang ba yin //
translated: Or the appearance of something else?

original: gal te mi snang 'khrul yin na //
analyzed: gal te mi snang 'khrul yin na //
translated: If the non-appearance of something is error,

original: thams cad la 'gyur ldog pa med //
analyzed: thams cad la 'gyur ldog pa med //
translated: then there is no change in anything.

original: de ltar de nyid snang na ni //
analyzed: de ltar de nyid snang na ni //
translated: If it appears as that,

original: ji ltar 'khrul pa yin par brjod //
analyzed: ji ltar 'khrul pa yin par brjod //
translated: how can it be called error?

original: gal te thams cad mi snang ba 'khrul pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te thams cad mi snang ba 'khrul pa yin na /
translated: If the non-appearance of something is error,

original: gnyid stug po log pa dang rdol sogs pa yang 'khrul pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyid stug po log pa dang rdol sogs pa yang 'khrul pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it follows that deep sleep and fainting are error.

original: gal te rim ma yin pa mi snang ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te rim ma yin pa mi snang ba yin na /
translated: If the non-appearance of something in a different order is error,

original: de lta na ni 'o na ni rim pa nyid nyams pa med par snang ba yin to /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na ni rim pa nyid nyams pa med par snang ba yin to /
translated: then the appearance of the very same order without loss is not error.

original: des na 'khrul par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: des na 'khrul par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: So how can it be error?

original: ka ba la sogs pa snang ba nyid ni 'khrul par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: ka ba la sogs pa snang ba nyid ni 'khrul par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: The appearance of pillars and so on is not error.

original: gal te gzhan snang 'khrul yin na //
analyzed: gal te gzhan snang 'khrul yin na //
translated: If the appearance of something else is error,

original: rang dngos snang bar ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: rang dngos snang bar ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: how can one‚Äôs own entity appear?

original: rang gi ngo bo mi snang yang //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo mi snang yang //
translated: Even if one‚Äôs own entity does not appear,

original: de med pas na ji ltar 'khrul //üîΩgal te brjod par 'dod pa las gzhan snang ba nyid 'khrul ba yin @262a * //
analyzed: de med pas na ji ltar 'khrul // gal te brjod par 'dod pa las gzhan snang ba nyid 'khrul ba yin @262a * //
translated: If it is not, how can it be mistaken?

original: na de'i tshe de'i rang gi ngo bor snang ba nyid med pas ji ltar blo de yod pa yin /
analyzed: na de'i tshe de'i rang gi ngo bor snang ba nyid med pas ji ltar blo de yod pa yin /
translated: If the appearance itself that is other than what is desired to be expressed is mistaken, then at that time, since the appearance of its own entity does not exist, how can that mind exist?

original: gal te mi snang yang blo yod na ni thams cad kyi tshe thams cad la blo thams cad yod pa dang / 'khrul par yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te mi snang yang blo yod na ni thams cad kyi tshe thams cad la blo thams cad yod pa dang / 'khrul par yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: If the mind exists even though it does not appear, then at all times all minds would exist in regard to all objects, and it would also be said that they are mistaken.

original: 'on te blo de ni med pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te blo de ni med pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: But if that mind does not exist,

original: 'o na de lta na ni rim pa dang ldan pa'i blo ni med pa kho na yin pa dang / rim pa ma yin pa gzhan skyes pa yin pa'i phyir ji ltar 'khrul pa yin /
analyzed: 'o na de lta na ni rim pa dang ldan pa'i blo ni med pa kho na yin pa dang / rim pa ma yin pa gzhan skyes pa yin pa'i phyir ji ltar 'khrul pa yin /
translated: then in that case, since a mind that possesses a sequence does not exist at all and a mind that does not possess a sequence arises, how can it be mistaken?

original: 'on te de'i gzhal bya med pa'i phyir de 'khrul pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te de'i gzhal bya med pa'i phyir de 'khrul pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that it is mistaken because its object of comprehension does not exist,

original: rim ma yin pa til la sogs pa la rim ma yin pa nyid kyi blo'i gzhal bya yod pa yin te /
analyzed: rim ma yin pa til la sogs pa la rim ma yin pa nyid kyi blo'i gzhal bya yod pa yin te /
translated: then the object of comprehension of a mind that does not possess a sequence in regard to sesame seeds and so on does exist.

original: gzhan du snang ba'i phyir na slar la rim pa dang ldan pa'i gzhal bya nyid med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gzhan du snang ba'i phyir na slar la rim pa dang ldan pa'i gzhal bya nyid med pa ma yin nam /
translated: But since it appears otherwise, is it not the case that the object of comprehension is not endowed with stages?

original: 'on te rim ma yin pa ni gzhal bya nyid ma yin pa des na de ltar 'gyur pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rim ma yin pa ni gzhal bya nyid ma yin pa des na de ltar 'gyur pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if the non-sequential is not the object of comprehension, then that is the case.

original: 'o na ni rang gi ngo bo la yang rim ma yin par snang ba med pa des na 'khrul pa dang mi ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni rang gi ngo bo la yang rim ma yin par snang ba med pa des na 'khrul pa dang mi ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if the non-sequential does not appear even to its own nature, then it would not be mistaken.

original: 'on te / gal te blo yi ngo bo la //
analyzed: 'on te / gal te blo yi ngo bo la //
translated: But if the nature of the mind

original: blo gzhan 'dzin par byed yin na //üîΩrim gyis 'dzin pa'i ngo bo ni //
analyzed: blo gzhan 'dzin par byed yin na // rim gyis 'dzin pa'i ngo bo ni //
translated: is apprehended by another mind,üîΩhow could the nature of the sequential

original: ji ltar rim mi snang bar 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar rim mi snang bar 'gyur //
translated: appear as non-sequential?

original: gal te rim pa dang ldan pa'i blo blo gzhan gyis 'dzin na nor bu dang mu tig la sogs pa'i gzhal bya rim ma yin par snang bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te rim pa dang ldan pa'i blo blo gzhan gyis 'dzin na nor bu dang mu tig la sogs pa'i gzhal bya rim ma yin par snang bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: If the sequential mind is apprehended by another mind, then the object of comprehension such as a jewel or a pearl would not appear as non-sequential,

original: de 'dzin pa'i blo rim gyis 'jug pa'i phyir dang / blo 'dzin par byed pa yang gzhal bya la mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'dzin pa'i blo rim gyis 'jug pa'i phyir dang / blo 'dzin par byed pa yang gzhal bya la mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mind that apprehends it engages sequentially, and because the mind that apprehends the mind does not engage the object of comprehension.

original: rim ma yin par snang ba ni med do //
analyzed: rim ma yin par snang ba ni med do //
translated: But there is no appearance of them in a non-sequential order.

original: gal te 'khrul pas de snang na //
analyzed: gal te 'khrul pas de snang na //
translated: If they appear through error,

original: de nyid 'khrul med yin par thal //
analyzed: de nyid 'khrul med yin par thal //
translated: then it follows that they are not non-erroneous.

original: de yi gzhal bya 'dzin pa ni //
analyzed: de yi gzhal bya 'dzin pa ni //
translated: If the object of knowledge is apprehendedüîΩin that way, how can it be refuted?

original: de ltar yin pa gang gis bzlog / gal te rim par snang ba can gyi blo skye ba yin na /
analyzed: de ltar yin pa gang gis bzlog / gal te rim par snang ba can gyi blo skye ba yin na /
translated: If the cognition that arises has a sequential appearance,

original: blo'i blo yang de ltar 'gyur dgos so //
analyzed: blo'i blo yang de ltar 'gyur dgos so //
translated: then the cognition of the cognition must also be like that.

original: 'khrul pas dus gcig tu 'dzin pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'khrul pas dus gcig tu 'dzin pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is apprehended simultaneously through error,

original: gcig gis cig car du ma bzung bar thal lo //
analyzed: gcig gis cig car du ma bzung bar thal lo //
translated: then it follows that one is not apprehended simultaneously.

original: snga ma dang phyi ma'i 'dzin pa dag gis ni gcig nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma'i 'dzin pa dag gis ni gcig nyid ma yin te /
translated: The apprehension of the former and the apprehension of the latter are not of one thing,

original: rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no conception of that.

original: blo phyi mas gcig gis rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: blo phyi mas gcig gis rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If the later cognition cognizes one thing,

original: rim pa dang ldan pa de yang gcig tu rtogs par ci ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rim pa dang ldan pa de yang gcig tu rtogs par ci ltar 'gyur te /
translated: how could that which has a sequential order be cognized as one?

original: 'dzin pa'i dus ni 'dzin par byed pa'i dus las 'das pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i dus ni 'dzin par byed pa'i dus las 'das pa ma yin no //
translated: The time of apprehension is not past the time of the apprehender.

original: 'on te 'di ni rim med pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te 'di ni rim med pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: But if it is claimed that there is no sequence,üîΩthen it follows that there is no apprehension of a sequence.

original: de lta yin na gcig gis du ma 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na gcig gis du ma 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then one would apprehend many.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di 'khrul pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di 'khrul pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it is mistaken.

original: de lta na yang du ma'i ngo bor snang ba yang mi ldog pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta na yang du ma'i ngo bor snang ba yang mi ldog pa nyid do //
translated: Even so, the appearance of many is not averted.

original: sna tshogs pa ni blo gcig nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: sna tshogs pa ni blo gcig nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is said that the variety is the very same cognition,

original: nor bu dang mu tig la sogs pa ci @262b ste ma yin /
analyzed: nor bu dang mu tig la sogs pa ci @262b ste ma yin /
translated: why is it not a jewel, a pearl, and so on?

original: gal te sngon po la sogs pa'i gzhal bya'i ngo bor snang yang blo'i ngo bo nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te sngon po la sogs pa'i gzhal bya'i ngo bor snang yang blo'i ngo bo nyid yin na /
translated: If it appears as the nature of the object of cognition, such as blue, but is the nature of cognition,

original: gzhal bya thams cad de lta bu nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhal bya thams cad de lta bu nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it follows that all objects of cognition are just that.

original: des na 'khrul pa la yang du ma cig car snang bar ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: des na 'khrul pa la yang du ma cig car snang bar ni mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable that even in error many appear simultaneously.

original: des na cig car ram gzhan du yang rung ste /
analyzed: des na cig car ram gzhan du yang rung ste /
translated: Therefore, whether simultaneously or successively,

original: gang zhig ji ltar nyams su myong ba de ni de kho na ltar khas blangs par byas te /
analyzed: gang zhig ji ltar nyams su myong ba de ni de kho na ltar khas blangs par byas te /
translated: whatever is experienced must be accepted just as it is,

original: de kho na ltar dpyad zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na ltar dpyad zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is analyzed just as it is.

original: de lta ma yin na gzhal bya gzhag pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gzhal bya gzhag pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the object of cognition would be unestablished.

original: gal te ri mo la sogs pa dag la sna tshogs blo rtogs pa yin na ji ltar gcig tu mi rigs /
analyzed: gal te ri mo la sogs pa dag la sna tshogs blo rtogs pa yin na ji ltar gcig tu mi rigs /
translated: If the cognition of a variety is in regard to a painting, etc., how is it not reasonable that it is one?

original: nor bu dang mu tig la sogs pa dag la ni sna tshogs pa gcig gi blo med de /
analyzed: nor bu dang mu tig la sogs pa dag la ni sna tshogs pa gcig gi blo med de /
translated: In regard to jewels, pearls, etc., there is no cognition of a variety as one.

original: rnam par dbye ba 'di ni blo'i rnam par dbye ba nyid las yin no zhe na /üîΩma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba 'di ni blo'i rnam par dbye ba nyid las yin no zhe na / ma yin te /
translated: This distinction is due to the distinction of cognition itself.

original: rang gi gzhung dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi gzhung dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because it contradicts your own scriptures.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / rigs mi mthun rnams rtsom med phyir //
analyzed: 'di ltar / rigs mi mthun rnams rtsom med phyir //
translated: Because of the absence of a beginning of dissimilar types,

original: ris sogs sna tshogs blo yod min //
analyzed: ris sogs sna tshogs blo yod min //
translated: there is no cognition of a variety such as a painting, etc.

original: gzugs med phyir ldan sna tshogs min //
analyzed: gzugs med phyir ldan sna tshogs min //
translated: Because of the absence of form, there is no variety of possession.

original: nye bar btags la brten pa'ang min //
analyzed: nye bar btags la brten pa'ang min //
translated: It is also not based on a mere designation.

original: gal te blo'i rjes su 'brang na rigs mi mthun pa rnams rtsom pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gzhung dor dgos so //
analyzed: gal te blo'i rjes su 'brang na rigs mi mthun pa rnams rtsom pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gzhung dor dgos so //
translated: If it follows cognition, then you must abandon the scripture that states, ‚Äúbecause of the absence of a beginning of dissimilar types.‚Äù

original: snam bu la sogs pa'i ngo bo ni rigs mi mthun pa'i snal ma'i ldan pa las skyes pa yin gyi yan lag can sna tshogs pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: snam bu la sogs pa'i ngo bo ni rigs mi mthun pa'i snal ma'i ldan pa las skyes pa yin gyi yan lag can sna tshogs pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: The nature of a cloth, etc., is produced from the possession of dissimilar types of threads, but the possessor is not a variety.

original: ci ste de ni blo 'khrul yin //
analyzed: ci ste de ni blo 'khrul yin //
translated: But if it is a deluded cognition,

original: de tshe'ang cig car 'dzin pa yod //
analyzed: de tshe'ang cig car 'dzin pa yod //
translated: then it is still a cognition of a multiplicity.

original: bden min rang bzhin 'dzin na ni //
analyzed: bden min rang bzhin 'dzin na ni //
translated: If it apprehends a nature that is not real,

original: ci ste bden dngos 'dzin ma yin //
analyzed: ci ste bden dngos 'dzin ma yin //
translated: then why does it not apprehend real entities?

original: blo 'khrul pa 'jug pa yin yang du ma cig car 'dzin par 'jug pa nyid do //
analyzed: blo 'khrul pa 'jug pa yin yang du ma cig car 'dzin par 'jug pa nyid do //
translated: Even though it is a deluded cognition, it is still a cognition of a multiplicity.üîΩWhat is the difference between the appearance of a multiplicity in front of us and the appearance of a multiplicity in a dream?

original: mdun na gnas par snang ba la bden pa dang mi bden pa'i rnam par dbye ba ci yod 'on te rang bzhin de ni blo nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: mdun na gnas par snang ba la bden pa dang mi bden pa'i rnam par dbye ba ci yod 'on te rang bzhin de ni blo nyid do zhe na /
translated: If you say that the nature of the mind is the multiplicity,

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: bden min rang bzhin de ji ltar //
analyzed: bden min rang bzhin de ji ltar //
translated: How can a nature that is not real

original: bden pa blo yi bdag nyid yin //
analyzed: bden pa blo yi bdag nyid yin //
translated: be the nature of a real mind?

original: gcig nyid yin na rnam dbye 'di //
analyzed: gcig nyid yin na rnam dbye 'di //
translated: If they are the same, then this distinction

original: mi bden yang na gcig ma yin //
analyzed: mi bden yang na gcig ma yin //
translated: between the real and the unreal is not tenable.

original: de lta na ni /
analyzed: de lta na ni /
translated: If they are not the same,

original: blo yi bdag nyid de yi ngo bor bden 'gyur ba //
analyzed: blo yi bdag nyid de yi ngo bor bden 'gyur ba //
translated: then the nature of the mind is real.

original: phyi rol rang bzhin ser sogs dag ni bden min na //
analyzed: phyi rol rang bzhin ser sogs dag ni bden min na //
translated: But if the external nature of yellow and so on is not real,üîΩthen the nature of the mind is not that.üîΩIt is not tenable to think that something that does not exist in something elseüîΩexists in it.

original: de la gal te mnog med de yi rang bzhin med //üîΩde la de med rtogs 'di rigs pas 'thad ma yin //
analyzed: de la gal te mnog med de yi rang bzhin med //üîΩde la de med rtogs 'di rigs pas 'thad ma yin //
translated: If the nature of the mind is not that,üîΩthen the nature of the mind is real.

original: ci ste bdag nyid kyi ngo bo ni du ma la yang blo gcig 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: ci ste bdag nyid kyi ngo bo ni du ma la yang blo gcig 'jug pa yin te /
translated: But if the cognition of a single object occurs even in regard to many entities,

original: de la 'bad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la 'bad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then it would occur without effort.

original: gzhan gyi ngo bo la ni 'gro ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi blo 'bad pa chen po dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo bo la ni 'gro ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi blo 'bad pa chen po dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: But the cognition of another‚Äôs nature, which is characterized by going, etc., is accompanied by great effort.

original: des na yul la sogs pa 'gal ba dag tu cig car 'gro ba mi srid pa'i phyir rnam pa gcig tu 'dzin pa mi srid do @263a * //
analyzed: des na yul la sogs pa 'gal ba dag tu cig car 'gro ba mi srid pa'i phyir rnam pa gcig tu 'dzin pa mi srid do @263a * //
translated: Therefore, since it is impossible for a single cognition to simultaneously go to objects, etc., which are mutually exclusive, it is impossible for a single cognition to apprehend a single object.

original: zhe na / gal te yin song nas 'dzin pa med pa yin na 'o na ni ljon pa'i rtse mo dang / zla ba dus gcig tu 'dzin pa mi srid par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhe na / gal te yin song nas 'dzin pa med pa yin na 'o na ni ljon pa'i rtse mo dang / zla ba dus gcig tu 'dzin pa mi srid par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you say that it apprehends after going, then it is impossible to apprehend the top of a tree and the moon simultaneously.

original: mgyogs par 'jug pa'i phyir cig car 'dzin par mngon pa yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: mgyogs par 'jug pa'i phyir cig car 'dzin par mngon pa yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If you say that it is perceived as simultaneous because it occurs quickly, that is not so,

original: shin tu thag ring ba la mgyogs pa nyid mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu thag ring ba la mgyogs pa nyid mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because speed is impossible in regard to what is very distant.

original: gzhan yang mig la sogs pa dag phrad nas 'dzin par byed do zhes bya ba 'di la tshad ma ci yod ce na /
analyzed: gzhan yang mig la sogs pa dag phrad nas 'dzin par byed do zhes bya ba 'di la tshad ma ci yod ce na /
translated: Moreover, what is the evidence for the claim that the eye, etc., apprehend after coming into contact?

original: pha rol po dag na re /
analyzed: pha rol po dag na re /
translated: The opponent says:

original: dmigs pa dang mi dmigs dag ni ma bsgribs pa dang cig shos la ltos pa'i phyir dang / ring ba dang cig shos la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang mi dmigs dag ni ma bsgribs pa dang cig shos la ltos pa'i phyir dang / ring ba dang cig shos la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because nonobstruction and obstruction are dependent on the unobstructed and the other, and because they are dependent on the distant and the near.

original: gal te mig dang rna ba dang / yid dag ni ma phrad pa'i yul can no zhes ji skad brjod pa bzhin du mig la sogs pa phrad par 'dzin par byed pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te mig dang rna ba dang / yid dag ni ma phrad pa'i yul can no zhes ji skad brjod pa bzhin du mig la sogs pa phrad par 'dzin par byed pa yin na /
translated: If, as you say, the eye, ear and mental consciousnesses have noncontiguous objects, then the eye and so on would apprehend objects by contact.

original: de'i tshe sgrib pa yod pas mi dmigs pa dang gzhan du ni dmigs pa zhes bya bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe sgrib pa yod pas mi dmigs pa dang gzhan du ni dmigs pa zhes bya bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, it would not be that objects are not apprehended due to obstruction, and that they are apprehended when there is no obstruction,

original: sgrib pa de la nyams par byed pa'i mthu ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sgrib pa de la nyams par byed pa'i mthu ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: because the eye would not have the power to penetrate the obstruction.

original: phrad nas 'dzin pa la ni lus can gyi rdzas thogs pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phrad nas 'dzin pa la ni lus can gyi rdzas thogs pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: If it were to apprehend by contact, then the substance of the body would be obstructed,

original: nyams par 'thad pa yin la /
analyzed: nyams par 'thad pa yin la /
translated: and it would be possible for it to be damaged.

original: shin tu thag ring por yang 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes 'dzer to //
analyzed: shin tu thag ring por yang 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes 'dzer to //
translated: But it does not go to a very distant place.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: ma phrad par 'dzin ba yin yang yul du rung ba la ltos pa'i phyir to /
analyzed: ma phrad par 'dzin ba yin yang yul du rung ba la ltos pa'i phyir to /
translated: Even though it apprehends without contact, it depends on a suitable object.

original: khab long bzhin no //
analyzed: khab long bzhin no //
translated: Like a magnet.

original: khab long ni ma phrad par 'dren pa la 'jug kyang lcags thams cad len par nus pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: khab long ni ma phrad par 'dren pa la 'jug kyang lcags thams cad len par nus pa ni ma yin no //
translated: A magnet attracts without contact, but it cannot attract all iron.

original: 'on te de la yang lcags dang reg pa yod pa nyid phra ba'i phyir ma 'phrigs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te de la yang lcags dang reg pa yod pa nyid phra ba'i phyir ma 'phrigs pa yin te /
translated: But in that case, the contact of the magnet with iron is subtle, and so is not perceived.

original: dper na mig gi 'ong zer gyi reg pa bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: dper na mig gi 'ong zer gyi reg pa bzhin no zhe na /
translated: For example, the contact of the eye with light.

original: 'di nyid gzhan gyis bsgrub par bya ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'di nyid gzhan gyis bsgrub par bya ba ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt that very contact to be established?

original: ji ltar de nyid sgrub byed du 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar de nyid sgrub byed du 'gyur /
translated: How can it be the means of establishing it?

original: de'i phyir / 'chal pa rnams kyi shin tu yang //
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'chal pa rnams kyi shin tu yang //
translated: Therefore,

original: tshogs chen pos ni brtags byas 'di //
analyzed: tshogs chen pos ni brtags byas 'di //
translated: This theory, imagined by the great teacher,

original: mkhas pa rnams kyis bzhad gang nyid //
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams kyis bzhad gang nyid //
translated: Is the laughing-stock of the wise.

original: 'jug 'gyur yang dag rig pa min //
analyzed: 'jug 'gyur yang dag rig pa min //
translated: It is not a correct theory.

original: 'on te phrad pa la 'dren par mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te phrad pa la 'dren par mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: But since attraction is seen in contact,üîΩattraction exists in the magnet.

original: khab long gi 'dren pa la yang de yod pa yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: khab long gi 'dren pa la yang de yod pa yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: No, it does not.

original: sngags kyis kyang 'dren par mthong bas des 'gugs pa yang reg par thal bas thal ches par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngags kyis kyang 'dren par mthong bas des 'gugs pa yang reg par thal bas thal ches par 'gyur ro //
translated: And since it is seen that mantras also summon, it follows that they would touch.

original: der yang 'gyur ba kho na'o zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: der yang 'gyur ba kho na'o zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If you accept that, then it follows that they would contact their objects.

original: sgra ni nam mkha'i yon tan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra ni nam mkha'i yon tan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But that is not so, because sound is a quality of space.

original: gal te ma nges par bstan pa'i phyir yul la yang chos de nyid sbyor na gang yang ma nges par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te ma nges par bstan pa'i phyir yul la yang chos de nyid sbyor na gang yang ma nges par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If you apply that reason to the object because it was taught without specifying, then it would not be unestablished.

original: de ni sngo @263b bsangs yin te de'i bu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba bu dkar sham gyi 'phrul par bstan pa na /
analyzed: de ni sngo @263b bsangs yin te de'i bu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba bu dkar sham gyi 'phrul par bstan pa na /
translated: If it is taught that ‚Äúhe is fair because he is the son of a fair man,‚Äù

original: de la yang sngo bsangs yod pa nyid do zhes bya bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la yang sngo bsangs yod pa nyid do zhes bya bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it follows that the son would also be fair.

original: ci ste mi mthong zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste mi mthong zhe na /
translated: If you say that he is not seen to be fair,

original: mi mthong ba'i rgyu rjes su dpag par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: mi mthong ba'i rgyu rjes su dpag par bya ba yin no //
translated: then you must infer the cause of his not being seen.

original: gzhan yang gal te mig gi 'od zer 'phros nas phrad par byed pa yin na /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te mig gi 'od zer 'phros nas phrad par byed pa yin na /
translated: Moreover, if the light rays of the eye travel and make contact,

original: ci'i phyir shin tu thag ring por mi mthong mar me'i 'od bzhin du mchod pa la yin pas nyes pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir shin tu thag ring por mi mthong mar me'i 'od bzhin du mchod pa la yin pas nyes pa med do zhe na /
translated: Why don‚Äôt you see very distant objects? Because of the light, just as you do not see the light of a lamp that is too close.

original: de lta na ni 'od shin tu nye ba la thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'od shin tu nye ba la thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But then it follows that you would see the light of a lamp that is too close.

original: mar me'i 'od ni shin tu nye ba la mi 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mar me'i 'od ni shin tu nye ba la mi 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: The light of a lamp does not fail to reach what is too close.

original: des na mig la sogs pa la ni mar me las chos gzhan dang ldan par khas blang bar bya ba de nyid 'dzin pa'i rgyu yin gyi /
analyzed: des na mig la sogs pa la ni mar me las chos gzhan dang ldan par khas blang bar bya ba de nyid 'dzin pa'i rgyu yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, you must admit that the eye and so on have a different property from the lamp, and that is the cause of grasping.

original: 'od dang phrad pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'od dang phrad pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the contact with light.

original: gal te mig la sogs pa la 'od zer yod na mun bar yang 'dzin par thal lo //
analyzed: gal te mig la sogs pa la 'od zer yod na mun bar yang 'dzin par thal lo //
translated: If the eye and so on had light rays, then it would follow that you would see in the dark.

original: 'on te gang las mgyogs par 'gyur ba de ni yid kyi nus pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gang las mgyogs par 'gyur ba de ni yid kyi nus pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the speed of the eye and so on is due to the power of the mind,

original: 'o na cig car 'dzin pa nyid skyed la rag mod /
analyzed: 'o na cig car 'dzin pa nyid skyed la rag mod /
translated: then it is possible that it produces the seeing of objects simultaneously.

original: 'bad pas brtags pa 'dis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: 'bad pas brtags pa 'dis ci zhig bya /
translated: What is the use of this investigation with effort?

original: de lta bu'i yid ni tshad mas grub pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu'i yid ni tshad mas grub pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And such a mind is not established by valid knowledge.

original: rnam par shes pa snga ma'i ngo bo yid la byed pa nyid kyis de'i don byed pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa snga ma'i ngo bo yid la byed pa nyid kyis de'i don byed pa yin te /
translated: The function of the prior consciousness is to make the object of the subsequent consciousness.

original: de yul gzhan la rtse gtang pas nus pa nyams pa na gzhan la shes pa mi skye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de yul gzhan la rtse gtang pas nus pa nyams pa na gzhan la shes pa mi skye ba'i phyir /
translated: When the potency of the prior consciousness is impaired by its transition to another object, the subsequent consciousness does not arise.

original: cig car rnam par shes pa mi skye ba yin no //
analyzed: cig car rnam par shes pa mi skye ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, consciousness does not arise simultaneously.

original: de'i phyir rtags de las yid rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rtags de las yid rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the mind is not inferred from that reason.

original: rnam pa gzhan du yang 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du yang 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is established in another way.

original: des na de rnams blo can la //
analyzed: des na de rnams blo can la //
translated: Therefore, the wise say that

original: 'dzin byed yin zhes rjod byed kyi //üîΩskam pa bzhin du shes pa yis //
analyzed: 'dzin byed yin zhes rjod byed kyi // skam pa bzhin du shes pa yis //
translated: the mind is the apprehender.üîΩBut consciousness is not seen

original: don 'dzin par ni mthong ba med //üîΩde phyir ri mo la rnam pa //
analyzed: don 'dzin par ni mthong ba med // de phyir ri mo la rnam pa //
translated: to apprehend objects like a hook.üîΩTherefore, the apprehension of many

original: du ma cig car 'dzin pa ni //üîΩ'khrul pa med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: du ma cig car 'dzin pa ni // 'khrul pa med pa kho na'o //
translated: aspects of a painting is nonerroneous.

original: ci ste de la sna tshogs pa ni ldan pa yin gyi yan lag can gyi gzugs ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste de la sna tshogs pa ni ldan pa yin gyi yan lag can gyi gzugs ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the variety belongs to the possessor of the aspects, not to the form of the possessor,

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: ldan pa ni yon tan yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ldan pa ni yon tan yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the possessor is a quality.

original: de la gzugs kyi yon tan 'du ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de la gzugs kyi yon tan 'du ba ma yin no //
translated: The qualities of form are not assembled in it.

original: de ltar gyur na ni yon tan dang ldan pas rdzas nyid du 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: de ltar gyur na ni yon tan dang ldan pas rdzas nyid du 'gyur ro ;
translated: If that were so, then it would be substance because it possesses qualities.

original: / de lta na yang rigs mi mthun pas mi rtsom pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gzhung dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: / de lta na yang rigs mi mthun pas mi rtsom pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gzhung dang 'gal lo //
translated: But in that case, it would contradict the treatise statement, ‚ÄúBecause it does not commence that which is heterogeneous.‚Äù

original: 'on te nye bar btags pa'i sgo nas ldan pa sna tshogs nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te nye bar btags pa'i sgo nas ldan pa sna tshogs nyid do zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is a variety of possession that is imputed,

original: de yang legs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang legs pa ma yin te /
translated: that is also not good.

original: dper na me tog rgyas pa'i nags zhes bya ba'i blo don gcig la 'du ba las 'gyur ba de bzhin du @264a * //
analyzed: dper na me tog rgyas pa'i nags zhes bya ba'i blo don gcig la 'du ba las 'gyur ba de bzhin du @264a * //
translated: For example, the cognition of a forest in bloom is a single object that is assembled from many.

original: 'di yang 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'di yang 'gyur na /
translated: If that were so,

original: 'di gnyis ni mi mtshungs so //
analyzed: 'di gnyis ni mi mtshungs so //
translated: then these two are not similar.üîΩIf the forest that is the mere number of many trees is assembled in the trees that possess blooming flowers, then it is reasonable to say that it is assembled in a single object.

original: mang po'i grangs nyid kyi nags gang yin pa ni gal te me tog rgyas pa nyid yod pa'i shing dag la 'du ba des na don gcig la 'phrod pa 'du ba zhes bya bar rigs na sna tshogs pa ni 'dir gang na ldan pa yod pa'i yan lag
analyzed: mang po'i grangs nyid kyi nags gang yin pa ni gal te me tog rgyas pa nyid yod pa'i shing dag la 'du ba des na don gcig la 'phrod pa 'du ba zhes bya bar rigs na sna tshogs pa ni 'dir gang na ldan pa yod pa'i yan lag
translated: But here, in the case of a variety, where is the part that possesses possession?

original: can nyid la 'du ba ma yin no zhes gang 'chad pa /
analyzed: can nyid la 'du ba ma yin no zhes gang 'chad pa /
translated: But it is not a composite of the parts themselves.

original: re re sna tshogs min phyir ro //
analyzed: re re sna tshogs min phyir ro //
translated: Because each is not a diversity.

original: zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: This is the meaning of the verse.

original: gang dang 'du bas ldan pa yang de ltar 'gyur ba skud pa la sogs pa re re ni sna tshogs pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: gang dang 'du bas ldan pa yang de ltar 'gyur ba skud pa la sogs pa re re ni sna tshogs pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: But each thread, etc., is not a diversity.

original: 'on te ji ltar me la mer bzung ba /
analyzed: 'on te ji ltar me la mer bzung ba /
translated: But just as when fire is apprehended as fire,

original: chos mthun pa rno ba nyid bzung bas me'i bag chags sad par gyur pa ni /
analyzed: chos mthun pa rno ba nyid bzung bas me'i bag chags sad par gyur pa ni /
translated: the universal characteristic of heat is apprehended, and the latent potentialities of fire are awakened,

original: de dran pas bram ze'i khye'u la yang mer sgro 'dogs pa byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: de dran pas bram ze'i khye'u la yang mer sgro 'dogs pa byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: and because of the memory of that, the fire is imputed to the young brahmin,

original: sngon po la sogs pa rim gyis bzung ba dag las gcig bzung ba'i dus su bzung ba la sgro 'dogs par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa rim gyis bzung ba dag las gcig bzung ba'i dus su bzung ba la sgro 'dogs par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: in the same way, from the gradual apprehension of blue, etc., at the time of the apprehension of one, the apprehension of diversity is imputed.üîΩThat is not tenable, because:

original: sna tshogs par rtogs pa yin no zhe na de ni mi 'thad de 'di ltar /
analyzed: sna tshogs par rtogs pa yin no zhe na de ni mi 'thad de 'di ltar /
translated: The various are not mixed

original: rim bzhin du ni bzung ba la //üîΩsna tshogs blo yis bsres min te /
analyzed: rim bzhin du ni bzung ba la // sna tshogs blo yis bsres min te /
translated: by the cognition of sequence.

original: gcig gis du ma mi 'dzin phyir //
analyzed: gcig gis du ma mi 'dzin phyir //
translated: Because one does not apprehend many.

original: de la ni rno ba nyid du 'dra ba'i sgro 'dogs pa'i rgyu mtshan yin na mthong ba'i sngon po la sogs pa la 'dir sgro ji ltar 'dogs /
analyzed: de la ni rno ba nyid du 'dra ba'i sgro 'dogs pa'i rgyu mtshan yin na mthong ba'i sngon po la sogs pa la 'dir sgro ji ltar 'dogs /
translated: If the reason for the superimposition is the similarity of sharpness, how can one superimpose this on the seen blue, etc.?

original: 'on te nye bas so zhe na nye bar 'dzin pa ni cig car 'dzin pa nyid la rig pa dang ldan gyi rim gyis 'dzin na ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te nye bas so zhe na nye bar 'dzin pa ni cig car 'dzin pa nyid la rig pa dang ldan gyi rim gyis 'dzin na ni ma yin no //
translated: But if it is by proximity, then the apprehension of proximity is only the apprehension of simultaneity, not the apprehension of sequence.

original: yul de bzung ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: yul de bzung ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If it is because that object is apprehended,

original: yul der bzung ba yang snga ma dang phyi ma dag la sna tshogs par bzung ba ni med do //
analyzed: yul der bzung ba yang snga ma dang phyi ma dag la sna tshogs par bzung ba ni med do //
translated: then the apprehension of that object is not the apprehension of the variety in the prior and subsequent moments.

original: sgro btags pas 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya bar ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: sgro btags pas 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya bar ni mi rigs te /
translated: It is not reasonable to say that it is due to superimposition,

original: de nyid bsam par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid bsam par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that itself is what is to be considered.

original: 'on te tha dad pa ma bzung ba'i phyir dran pa la gzung bar bya ba nyid du snang ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te tha dad pa ma bzung ba'i phyir dran pa la gzung bar bya ba nyid du snang ba yin no zhe na /
translated: But if it is because the difference is not apprehended, and the object of apprehension appears in memory,

original: ji ltar gzhan la gzhan du 'dzin //
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan la gzhan du 'dzin //
translated: how can one apprehend one thing as another?

original: de ni dran par bya ba'i rang bzhin yongs su spangs nas snang ba nyid 'dzin pa yin te nges na bsre ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni dran par bya ba'i rang bzhin yongs su spangs nas snang ba nyid 'dzin pa yin te nges na bsre ba ma yin no //
translated: It is the apprehension of the appearance itself, having completely abandoned the nature of memory. If it were so, it would not be a mixing.

original: 'on te bsre ba ni 'dzin pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te bsre ba ni 'dzin pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhe na /
translated: But if mixing is the nature of apprehension,

original: de lta yin na du ma gcig gis 'dzin par thal na 'dod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin na du ma gcig gis 'dzin par thal na 'dod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: then it would follow that the many are apprehended as one, and that is not accepted.

original: mig gi byed pas thams cad shes par rtogs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mig gi byed pas thams cad shes par rtogs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because all is understood through the function of the eye.

original: des na ma 'brel par rtogs pa'i dri mas mtshon pa blun po'i skye bos brtags pa 'dis ni chog go zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: des na ma 'brel par rtogs pa'i dri mas mtshon pa blun po'i skye bos brtags pa 'dis ni chog go zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: Therefore, this investigation by the foolish, who are characterized by the stain of understanding without connection, is sufficient.

original: de phyir gcig don du ma can //
analyzed: de phyir gcig don du ma can //
translated: Therefore, one thing has many meanings.

original: gang phyir don gcig rtog pa na'ang //
analyzed: gang phyir don gcig rtog pa na'ang //
translated: Because when one meaning is imagined,

original: @264b gzhan dag mthong ba de phyir yang //
analyzed: @264b gzhan dag mthong ba de phyir yang //
translated: the other is seen. Therefore,

original: rtog pa med pa grub pa yin //
analyzed: rtog pa med pa grub pa yin //
translated: the non-imagination is established.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo du ma can sna tshogs par snang ba na 'di sngon po zhes rnam par rtog par byed kyang mtha' na 'dug pa'i ser po la sogs pa mthong ba nyid do //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo du ma can sna tshogs par snang ba na 'di sngon po zhes rnam par rtog par byed kyang mtha' na 'dug pa'i ser po la sogs pa mthong ba nyid do //
translated: When the nature of blue, etc., which has many aspects, appears as various, one discriminates it as ‚Äúblue,‚Äù but in the end one sees yellow, etc.

original: rnam par rtog pa du ma cig car 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa du ma cig car 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: Many discriminations do not occur simultaneously.

original: sna tshogs pa zhes rnam par brtag par rung ba kho na'o zhe na ma yin te nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgdon mi za bar sna tshogs pa //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa zhes rnam par brtag par rung ba kho na'o zhe na ma yin te nges pa med pa'i phyir ro // gdon mi za bar sna tshogs pa //
translated: It is only proper to discriminate it as ‚Äúvarious,‚Äù but that is not so, because there is no certainty.

original: zhes bya ba nyid du brtags par bya ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba nyid du brtags par bya ba ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not that one must discriminate it as ‚Äúvarious.‚Äù

original: gcig la yang rtogs pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig la yang rtogs pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one sees the realization of even a single thing.

original: de lta na yang cig car ba'i sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa thams cad ni /
analyzed: de lta na yang cig car ba'i sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa thams cad ni /
translated: Even so, all the aspects of blue, etc., which are simultaneous,

original: rnam pa sna tshogs pa can gyi blo gcig go //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs pa can gyi blo gcig go //
translated: are the single cognition which has various aspects.

original: de la yang rtsod pa /üîΩsna tshogs snang can don rnams la //
analyzed: de la yang rtsod pa / sna tshogs snang can don rnams la //
translated: In that regard, there is an objection:üîΩIf it is not reasonable that various objects

original: gal te gcig nyid mi rigs na //
analyzed: gal te gcig nyid mi rigs na //
translated: are a single thing,

original: re zhig gcig pu'i blo de nyid //
analyzed: re zhig gcig pu'i blo de nyid //
translated: then that very cognition of a single thing

original: sna tshogs su ni ji ltar snang //
analyzed: sna tshogs su ni ji ltar snang //
translated: How can it appear as various things?

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te /üîΩji ltar blo nyid sna tshogs kyi //
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te / ji ltar blo nyid sna tshogs kyi //
translated: This is what is being taught.üîΩJust as you accept that the mind itself

original: rnam dbyer khyed kyis khas blangs pa //
analyzed: rnam dbyer khyed kyis khas blangs pa //
translated: Is differentiated as various things,

original: phyi yang gal te de lta nyid //
analyzed: phyi yang gal te de lta nyid //

analyzed: de la gang gis rnam dbye byed //

analyzed: gang la blo ni sna tshogs phyir //

analyzed: don rnams sna tshogs ngo bo ni //

analyzed: de la gnas pa'i ngo bo can //

analyzed: blo ni ji ltar 'gyur ma yin //

analyzed: des na sna tshogs pa yin pa'i phyir /

analyzed: ji lta ji ltar don bsams pa //

original: de lta de ltar rnam bral zhes //
analyzed: de lta de ltar rnam bral zhes //

original: mkhas pa rnams kyis gang gsungs pa //
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams kyis gang gsungs pa //

original: de ni dngos stobs 'ongs pa yin //
analyzed: de ni dngos stobs 'ongs pa yin //

analyzed: gcig la sna tshogs de cir 'gyur //

original: de ni blo la'ang mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: de ni blo la'ang mi 'grub bo //

original: gal te don bdag 'dir 'dod na //
analyzed: gal te don bdag 'dir 'dod na //

analyzed: de la bdag gis ci zhig bya //

analyzed: de la yang rnam pa du ma yin pa'i phyir du ma nyid du 'gyur te /

analyzed: dngos po'i mtshan nyid rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: rnam pa du ma 'dzin na dngos pa yang gdon mi za bar du mar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de'i phyir gal te blo de snyed yin na phyogs phyi ma smra ba la chad pa yod /

analyzed: ci ste blo du ma nyid yin na /

original: de ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni yod pa ma yin te /

original: mthong ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba nyid kyi phyir ro //

original: mthong ba yang mi 'thad do zhes bya ba ni med do //
analyzed: mthong ba yang mi 'thad do zhes bya ba ni med do //

original: 'o na ni rang rig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ni rang rig pa ma yin te /

original: phan tshun yang rig pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de yang ston par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: rang rig pa yin na ni gzhan rig pa la dogs pa yod pa ma yin no //

original: 'on te mang po nyid du rtogs pa gang zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te mang po nyid du rtogs pa gang zhig yin zhe na /
translated: But if it is not reflexive awareness, then what is the awareness that understands that it understands many things?

original: 'ga' yang ma yin te de las tha dad pa'i rtogs par byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ga' yang ma yin te de las tha dad pa'i rtogs par byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is none, because there is no understanding that is different from that.üîΩTherefore:

original: de'i phyir / blo rnams gcig pa ma yin zhing //
analyzed: de'i phyir / blo rnams gcig pa ma yin zhing //

original: du ma nyid du'ang 'thad ma yin //
analyzed: du ma nyid du'ang 'thad ma yin //

original: gcig na sna tshogs med 'gyur te //
analyzed: gcig na sna tshogs med 'gyur te //

original: du ma nyid la 'di ches gsal //
analyzed: du ma nyid la 'di ches gsal //

original: de'i phyir dngos po rnams ji ltar rnam par bsams pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po rnams ji ltar rnam par bsams pa /

original: de lta de ltar rnam par gzhigs par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'di la ci zhig byar yod /
analyzed: de lta de ltar rnam par gzhigs par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'di la ci zhig byar yod /

analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pas stong ngo zhes gsungs pas na chos thams cad ni stong pa nyid do zhes bya bar rigs so //

original: ci ste gcig dang du ma'i rnam par rtog pas snang ba nyid med par ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste gcig dang du ma'i rnam par rtog pas snang ba nyid med par ji ltar 'gyur te /

original: de ni rnam par brtags kyang snang ba kho na'o zhen /
analyzed: de ni rnam par brtags kyang snang ba kho na'o zhen /
translated: It is only appearance, even though it is analyzed,‚Äù

analyzed: sgyu ma dang smig rgyu la sogs pa ltar med kyang skyon med do //

original: de dag kyang med pa yin na ji ltar snang /
analyzed: de dag kyang med pa yin na ji ltar snang /

analyzed: snang ngo zhe na ni ji ltar med pa nyid yin zhe na /

original: yod pa'i mtshan nyid ni don byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa'i mtshan nyid ni don byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: snang ba tsam gyis yod pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: snang ba tsam gyis yod pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /

original: skra shad la sogs pa snang ba yin yang med par nges phyir ro //
analyzed: skra shad la sogs pa snang ba yin yang med par nges phyir ro //

original: don byed pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig yin /
analyzed: don byed pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig yin /

original: 'on te de nyid yin /
analyzed: 'on te de nyid yin /

original: gzhan yin no zhe na ni /
analyzed: gzhan yin no zhe na ni /

analyzed: de la yang snang ba'i rang bzhin las don byed pa gzhan khas len pa na thug pa med pas mi rtogs par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de nyid na ni snang ba thams cad yod par thal ba'i phyir //

original: sgyu ma la sogs pa med par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgyu ma la sogs pa med par mi 'gyur ro //

original: 'di la brjod pa 'ga' zhig gi ni tha snyad de //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa 'ga' zhig gi ni tha snyad de //

original: 'ga' zhig gi ni bzlog pas yin //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi ni bzlog pas yin //

original: rnam par dbye bas gnas pa 'di //
analyzed: rnam par dbye bas gnas pa 'di //

original: dngos @265b po rnams kyi rang bzhin yin //
analyzed: dngos @265b po rnams kyi rang bzhin yin //

original: snang ba tsam nyid kyis ni thams cad don byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: snang ba tsam nyid kyis ni thams cad don byed pa ma yin te /

analyzed: tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pas yong pa nyid rnam par gnas pa'i phyir ro //

original: de lta yin na ni snang ba thams cad med par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta yin na ni snang ba thams cad med par mi 'gyur te /

analyzed: 'ga' zhig don byed pa dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro zhe na ma yin te /

analyzed: gzhan gyis khas blangs pa'i sgo nas thal bar 'gyur ba byed pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: yod par smra ba ni don byed pas yod par khas len par byed do //

analyzed: des na don byed pa snang ba las tha dad pa yin no //

analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin las don byed pa gzhan na snang ba med do //

analyzed: gang zhig gang gis 'dod pa de nyid don byed pa yin no zhe na /

original: gdung ba dang tshim pa dag gnas pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gdung ba dang tshim pa dag gnas pa med pa'i phyir te /

original: goms pa'i stobs kyis thams cad la skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: goms pa'i stobs kyis thams cad la skyes pa'i phyir ro //

original: goms pa med pa'i ni med pa'i phyir /

original: don dam pa nyid do zhes rnam par gnas so //

analyzed: gal te de ltar na goms pa'i stobs kyis shes pa nyid de ltar gyur pa yin gyi /

analyzed: med pa ni ma yin no zhe na ma rig pa'i stobs kyis skyed pa nyid med pa yin te /

original: de lta bu gnas pa'i rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bu gnas pa'i rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because such a nature of existence does not exist.

original: snang ba tsam ma brtags na nyams dga' bar yod pa'i phyir ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: snang ba tsam ma brtags na nyams dga' bar yod pa'i phyir ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa nyid yin no //
translated: Because mere appearance is pleasant without examination, it is conventional truth.

original: de'i phyir don dang shes pa la //
analyzed: de'i phyir don dang shes pa la //
translated: Therefore, in regard to objects and consciousness,

original: rags snang yod min de dag nyid //
analyzed: rags snang yod min de dag nyid //

analyzed: gcig la bkag pa nyid phyir dang // mang po la yang yod ma yin //
