original: phyogs kyi cha rnams kyang phan tshun yongs su spangs pas gnas pa'i phyir gcig ma yin no //
analyzed: phyogs kyi cha rnams kyang phan tshun yongs su spangs pas gnas pa'i phyir gcig ma yin no //
translated: And because the parts are mutually exclusive, they do not exist as one.

original: ci ste dags par snang ba ni mang po la yod pa yin te /
analyzed: ci ste dags par snang ba ni mang po la yod pa yin te /
translated: If it is said that the appearance of a coarse object is in many,üîΩthen it is said that many of the same type appear to be one, and the convention of a coarse object is made.

original: 'di ltar rigs mthun pa mang po gzhan gyis mchod par snang ba na rags pa nyid du tha snyad byed pa yin no zhe na de yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: 'di ltar rigs mthun pa mang po gzhan gyis mchod par snang ba na rags pa nyid du tha snyad byed pa yin no zhe na de yang mi 'thad de /

original: de dag ni mang po kho na yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni mang po kho na yin te /
translated: Because those are many,

original: rags pa nyid so so la med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rags pa nyid so so la med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and the coarse object does not exist in each.

original: tshogs pa yin par 'gyur ro @266a * //
analyzed: tshogs pa yin par 'gyur ro @266a * //

analyzed: phan tshun tha dad par snang ba ni lings po gcig tu snang ba yod pa ma yin te /
translated: then the appearance of mutual difference in the atoms would not be the appearance of a single mass.

original: bar yang snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bar yang snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the space between the atoms would also appear.

original: 'on te mi snang na /
analyzed: 'on te mi snang na /
translated: But if you say that the space between the atoms does not appear,

original: 'o na ni de dag snang bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni de dag snang bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then the atoms would not appear.

original: ci ste rdul phra rab dengs pa na de dag ldan pa las yan lag can gzhan nyid skye ba yin te /
analyzed: ci ste rdul phra rab dengs pa na de dag ldan pa las yan lag can gzhan nyid skye ba yin te /

original: de la rdul phra rab bam yan lag ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no snyam na gal te yan lag can gzhan nyid skyes pa yin na de lta na ni /üîΩsa bon las myu gu bzhin rdul phra rab zhig cing /
analyzed: de la rdul phra rab bam yan lag ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no snyam na gal te yan lag can gzhan nyid skyes pa yin na de lta na ni / sa bon las myu gu bzhin rdul phra rab zhig cing /
translated: If the whole is produced from the atoms,

original: yan lag can gzhan skyes bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yan lag can gzhan skyes bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then like a seed producing a sprout, the atoms would be destroyed and the whole would be produced.

original: des na ldan pa dang lhan cig pa'i rdul phra rab la sogs pas rang dang phrad pas 'dus pa'i yan lag can rtsom par byed pa'i phyir snal ma la sogs pa 'du ba can gyi rgyu yin no zhes bya bar mi 'gyur te /

translated: Therefore, since the subtle particles that possess or are conjoined with other particles and so on create the composite whole by contacting themselves, it is not tenable to say that thread and so on are the cause of the composite whole.

original: 'brel ba nyid ni gnyis la gnas ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel ba nyid ni gnyis la gnas ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the connection itself exists in two things.

original: 'di la'o snyam pa'i blo yang dmigs pa med par 'gyur te dmigs pa'i don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di la'o snyam pa'i blo yang dmigs pa med par 'gyur te dmigs pa'i don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Also the cognition thinking this would be without an object because the object of cognition would not exist.

original: cha med pa de bzung ba na pha rol la sogs pa'i cha yang bzung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cha med pa de bzung ba na pha rol la sogs pa'i cha yang bzung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that partless thing is apprehended, the other part and so on would also be apprehended.

analyzed: tshu rol gyi cha bzung na pha rol yang mthong bar 'gyur te de yang pha rol gyi cha'i yan lag can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the part of this side is apprehended, the other side would also be seen because that is a part of the other side.

original: des na thams cad thams cad mthong bar 'gyur ro //üîΩ'on te pha rol gyi cha ni mthong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: des na thams cad thams cad mthong bar 'gyur ro // 'on te pha rol gyi cha ni mthong ba ma yin te /
translated: Therefore everything would see everything.üîΩBut if the other part is not seen,

original: pha rol gyi cha nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: pha rol gyi cha nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: then the other part itself does not exist.

original: gzhan gyis ji ltar mthong ba yin pa de ni gzhan nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyis ji ltar mthong ba yin pa de ni gzhan nyid do zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is other because it is seen as other,

original: 'o na ni 'di yan lag can nam rags par ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni 'di yan lag can nam rags par ni mi 'gyur ro //

analyzed: gal te don dam par ni thams cad stong pa yin la bcom ldan 'das kyang de kho na gzigs pa yin na //
translated: If all things are empty in the ultimate sense, and the Bhagavat sees only that,

original: de ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis phyi rol gyi don bstan par mdzad de de kho na gzigs pa ni de kho na nyid ma yin pa ston par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis phyi rol gyi don bstan par mdzad de de kho na gzigs pa ni de kho na nyid ma yin pa ston par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: How could the Lord teach external things? One who sees reality does not teach what is not reality.

original: ston na yang ji ltar de kho na gzigs pa yin no zhes khod du chud ce na /
analyzed: ston na yang ji ltar de kho na gzigs pa yin no zhes khod du chud ce na /
translated: Even if he did teach, how could he be understood to be one who sees reality?

original: 'di la smras pa phyi rol sgrub pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis phyi rol bstan pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di la smras pa phyi rol sgrub pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis phyi rol bstan pa ni ma yin no //
translated: We reply: The Lord did not teach external things in order to establish external things.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: rjes su de brjod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rjes su de brjod pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because he repeats it.

original: de rjes su brjod pas bdag bkag par brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rjes su brjod pas bdag bkag par brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he wishes to express the negation of the self by repeating it.

original: stong pa nyid mthong ba rjes su brjod par yang ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid mthong ba rjes su brjod par yang ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: But how can the seeing of emptiness be repeated?

original: de snang ba med pa'i phyir ro zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: de snang ba med pa'i phyir ro zhe na ma yin te /
translated: Because it does not appear.

original: 'jig rten gyi thugs nyid kyis rjes su brjod pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi thugs nyid kyis rjes su brjod pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because it is possible to repeat it by the mere thought of it.

original: 'jig rten gyi blo de lta bu yang thog ma med pa nas ma rig pa goms pa las yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi blo de lta bu yang thog ma med pa nas ma rig pa goms pa las yin no //
translated: And that kind of worldly thought is due to the habituation to ignorance from beginningless time.

original: gal te bcom ldan 'das la 'jig rten gyi blo mnga' na ji ltar de kho na mthong ba yin zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te bcom ldan 'das la 'jig rten gyi blo mnga' na ji ltar de kho na mthong ba yin zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If the Lord has worldly ideas, how can he see reality?

original: sngon gyi shugs kyis ston pa srid pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sngon gyi shugs kyis ston pa srid pa'i phyir te /
translated: No, because it is possible that he teaches by the force of former prayers.

original: @268a * // 'khor lo bskor ba bzhin no //
analyzed: @268a * // 'khor lo bskor ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like the turning of the wheel of Dharma.

original: des na 'jig rten gzhug pa'i don du du mar bstan pa 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: des na 'jig rten gzhug pa'i don du du mar bstan pa 'gal ba med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no contradiction in his teaching in many ways in order to lead the world.

original: de ltar re zhig stong pa nyid du khas blangs nas ma nges pa spangs nas /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig stong pa nyid du khas blangs nas ma nges pa spangs nas /
translated: Thus, having accepted emptiness for the time being, he rejects the charge of indeterminacy.

original: da ni sna tshogs par khas blangs te spong bar byed do //üîΩsna tshogs su snang ba yang blo ni gcig nyid du 'gyur te ;
analyzed: da ni sna tshogs par khas blangs te spong bar byed do // sna tshogs su snang ba yang blo ni gcig nyid du 'gyur te ;
translated: Now, having accepted diversity, he rejects the charge of indeterminacy.

original: phyi rol gyi sna tshogs dang mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i phyir ro //üîΩrnam par dbye bar nus pa'i sna tshogs ni du mar 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi sna tshogs dang mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i phyir ro // rnam par dbye bar nus pa'i sna tshogs ni du mar 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: The diversity of appearances is the diversity of consciousnesses, because the diversity of external things is not tenable.üîΩIf the diversity of appearances were the diversity of external things, then the diversity of consciousnesses would not exist, because the diversity of external things is not tenable.üîΩIf the diversity of consciousnesses does not exist, then the diversity of appearances would not exist.üîΩIf the diversity of appearances does not exist, then the diversity of things would not exist.

original: blo'i sngon po la sogs pa ni rnam par dbye bar nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: blo'i sngon po la sogs pa ni rnam par dbye bar nus pa ma yin no //
translated: If the diversity of things does not exist, then the diversity of activities would not exist.üîΩIf the diversity of activities does not exist, then the diversity of results would not exist.üîΩIf the diversity of results does not exist, then the diversity of consciousnesses would not exist.üîΩIf the diversity of consciousnesses does not exist, then the diversity of appearances would not exist.üîΩIf the diversity of appearances does not exist, then the diversity of things would not exist.üîΩIf the diversity of things does not exist, then the diversity of activities would not exist.üîΩIf the diversity of activities does not exist, then the diversity of results would not exist.üîΩIf the diversity of results does not exist, then the diversity of consciousnesses would not exist.üîΩIf the diversity of consciousnesses does not exist, then the diversity of appearances would not exist.üîΩIf the diversity of appearances does not exist, then the diversity of things would not exist.üîΩIf the diversity of things does not exist, then the diversity of activities would not exist.üîΩIf the diversity of activities does not exist, then the diversity of results would not exist.üîΩIf the diversity of results does not exist, then the diversity of consciousnesses would not exist.

original: 'di ltar / shes la sngo sogs sna tshogs pa //
analyzed: 'di ltar / shes la sngo sogs sna tshogs pa //
translated: If the diversity of consciousnesses does not exist, then the diversity of appearances would not exist.üîΩIf the diversity of appearances does not exist, then the diversity of things would not exist.üîΩIf the diversity of things does not exist, then the diversity of activities would not exist.üîΩIf the diversity of activities does not exist,

original: shes pa'i khyad par gzhan sten med //
analyzed: shes pa'i khyad par gzhan sten med //
translated: There is no other cognition that is different from it.

original: mthong nus ma yin de yi tshe //
analyzed: mthong nus ma yin de yi tshe //
translated: When it is not possible to see it,

original: rnam dbye don la 'jug par 'gyur //
analyzed: rnam dbye don la 'jug par 'gyur //
translated: then one enters into the meaning of the distinction.

original: rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i sna tshogs pa'i sngon po la sogs pa'i gang yin pa ni yan gar du mthong bar nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i sna tshogs pa'i sngon po la sogs pa'i gang yin pa ni yan gar du mthong bar nus pa ma yin te /
translated: The various blue, etc., which are of the nature of consciousness, are not capable of being seen separately,

original: des ni rnam bar dbye bar mi nus pa'i phyir na blo ni sna tshogs pa nyid yin yang gcig nyid do //
analyzed: des ni rnam bar dbye bar mi nus pa'i phyir na blo ni sna tshogs pa nyid yin yang gcig nyid do //
translated: because they cannot be distinguished. Therefore, although the cognition is various, it is one.

original: gal te sna tshogs kyang gcig yin na 'o na ni sgra la sogs par snang ba yang gcig tu 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te sna tshogs kyang gcig yin na 'o na ni sgra la sogs par snang ba yang gcig tu 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If the various is one, then the appearance as sound, etc. will also be one.

original: gal te rnam par dbye bar mi nus pa yin na 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te rnam par dbye bar mi nus pa yin na 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not possible to distinguish them, then it will be so.

original: 'on te rna ba bkag kyang gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa des na yang yan 'gar du 'dzin pa'i phyir du ma nyid do zhe na //
analyzed: 'on te rna ba bkag kyang gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa des na yang yan 'gar du 'dzin pa'i phyir du ma nyid do zhe na //
translated: But if, even when the ear is blocked, form, etc. are perceived, then because they are grasped separately, they are many.

original: de yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: de'i tshe shes pa rnam par 'byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe shes pa rnam par 'byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: At that time, the cognition is not distinguished.

original: mi snang ba'i phyir de'i tshe sngar gyi snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi snang ba'i phyir de'i tshe sngar gyi snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not manifest, because the previous manifestation does not exist at that time.

original: mi snang yang sgra yod pa des na tha dad ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mi snang yang sgra yod pa des na tha dad ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Even if it is not manifest, it is not different from the sound, because the sound exists.

original: de ni de'i tshe shes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de'i tshe shes pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not cognition at that time,

original: lkog tu gyur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is hidden.

original: de ltar rnam par dbye ba ni don la 'bab par 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par dbye ba ni don la 'bab par 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: Thus, the distinction is based on the object.

original: don ni rig pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don ni rig pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The object is not cognition.

original: ci ste lhan cig tu snang ba'i sngar gyi shes pa'i rnam pa las da ltar yan 'gar bar snang ba ni gzhan yin no zhes rnam par 'byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste lhan cig tu snang ba'i sngar gyi shes pa'i rnam pa las da ltar yan 'gar bar snang ba ni gzhan yin no zhes rnam par 'byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is distinguished as follows: ‚ÄúThe previous manifestation of the simultaneous appearance is one thing, the present separate appearance is another,‚Äù

original: de yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: snga ma nyid la ni /
analyzed: snga ma nyid la ni /
translated: In the previous case,

original: mngon sum gyi shes pa 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi shes pa 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: direct perception does not operate.üîΩHowever,

original: 'on kyang / shes gang ci ltar snang ba de //üîΩde lta nyid du myong ba yin //
analyzed: 'on kyang / shes gang ci ltar snang ba de // de lta nyid du myong ba yin //
translated: whatever cognition appearsüîΩis experienced just as it is.

original: de ltar 'gyur ro myong bar gyur to //
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur ro myong bar gyur to //
translated: ‚ÄúIt will be like that,‚Äù ‚Äúit was experienced like that‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba ni de med do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de med do //
translated: ‚Äîthat does not exist.

original: rang rig pa'i mngon sum ni lkog tu gyur pa las 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rang rig pa'i mngon sum ni lkog tu gyur pa las 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: Self-awareness is not a direct perception that engages an object that is hidden.

original: lkog tu gyur pa ni rang rig pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa ni rang rig pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a hidden object is not self-awareness.

original: 'on te dran pas shes par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te dran pas shes par byed do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that memory makes it known,

original: de @268b ni mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de @268b ni mi 'thad de /
translated: that is not tenable.

original: dran pa tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dran pa tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because memory is not a valid means of knowledge.

original: ci ste nyams su myong ba las skyes pa'i dran pa ni /
analyzed: ci ste nyams su myong ba las skyes pa'i dran pa ni /
translated: But if you say that memory that arises from experience

original: tshad ma nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: tshad ma nyid do zhe na /
translated: is a valid means of knowledge,üîΩthen there is not the slightest valid means of knowledge for the claim

original: nyams su myong ba las dran pa skyes pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di la ni tshad ma cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba las dran pa skyes pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di la ni tshad ma cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúMemory arises from experience.‚Äù

original: nyams su myong ba'i dus na dran pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i dus na dran pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when there is experience, there is no memory.

original: dran pa 'dis ni bdag nyams su myong ba las skyes so zhes bya bar shes pa yang med de /
analyzed: dran pa 'dis ni bdag nyams su myong ba las skyes so zhes bya bar shes pa yang med de /
translated: And this memory does not know ‚ÄúI arise from experience,‚Äù

original: myong ba ni de la ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: myong ba ni de la ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because experience is not seen in it.

original: nyams su myong ba yin na yang dran par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba yin na yang dran par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Even if there is experience, there is no memory,

original: de'i tshe nyams su myong ba kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe nyams su myong ba kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: because at that time there is only experience.

original: de'i phyir rnam par dbye bar mi nus pa'i sna tshogs pa ni gcig yin pas skyon med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par dbye bar mi nus pa'i sna tshogs pa ni gcig yin pas skyon med do //
translated: Therefore, the variety that cannot be divided is one, so there is no fault.

original: 'o na ni phyi rol yang rnam par dbye bar mi nus pa'i phyir na gcig nyid do zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ni phyi rol yang rnam par dbye bar mi nus pa'i phyir na gcig nyid do zhe na ma yin te /
translated: But if external things are also one because they cannot be divided, that is not so,

original: de nyid kyi tshe gzhan gyis gcig mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshe gzhan gyis gcig mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because at that time another person sees it.

original: 'on te pha rol gyis mthong ba gang yin pa de ni gzhan kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te pha rol gyis mthong ba gang yin pa de ni gzhan kho na'o zhe na /
translated: But if you say that what is seen by another person is just another thing,

original: 'o na ni shin tu yang rnam par phye ba yin no //
analyzed: 'o na ni shin tu yang rnam par phye ba yin no //
translated: then it is very well divided.

original: rang gis mthong ba nyid gcig yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gis mthong ba nyid gcig yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: But if you say that what is seen by oneself is one, that is not so,

original: rang rig pa la snang ba'i phyir de ni shes pa kho na'o //
analyzed: rang rig pa la snang ba'i phyir de ni shes pa kho na'o //
translated: because it is just consciousness, because it appears in self-awareness.

original: de ltar sems kyi rnam pa ni //
analyzed: de ltar sems kyi rnam pa ni //
translated: Thus the aspects of mind

original: sna tshogs gcig gi ngo bor 'gyur //
analyzed: sna tshogs gcig gi ngo bor 'gyur //
translated: become a variety in the nature of one.

original: shes pa ma rtogs pa ni rnam par dbyer med par yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa ma rtogs pa ni rnam par dbyer med par yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Consciousness that is not realized does not exist without being divided.

original: de'i phyir na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa sna tshogs pa ni blo gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa sna tshogs pa ni blo gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the various aspects such as blue, the apprehended object and apprehending subject, are one cognition.

original: sna tshogs ni gnyis med pa yin pa'am /
analyzed: sna tshogs ni gnyis med pa yin pa'am /
translated: The various is nondual,

original: ma yin na yang sna tshogs pa de sna tshogs ma yin pa las tha dad par gnas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin na yang sna tshogs pa de sna tshogs ma yin pa las tha dad par gnas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: or, even if it is not, because the various does not exist separately from the nonvarious.

original: des na gzhan med pa'i phyir myong ba gnyis med pa nyid 'ba' zhig yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: des na gzhan med pa'i phyir myong ba gnyis med pa nyid 'ba' zhig yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: Therefore, because of the absence of other, the experience is nondual, and it is only that which exists.

original: de lta na ni 'o na dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag gis tha dad pa srid pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag gis tha dad pa srid pa'i phyir /
translated: If that is so, then since the existence of difference by way of entity and nonentity is possible,

original: ji ltar gnyis med pa yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar gnyis med pa yin te /
translated: how is it nondual?üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / tha dad med na med de las //
analyzed: 'di ltar / tha dad med na med de las //
translated: If there is no difference, there is no nondifference.

original: tha mi dad tha dad gnas 'gyur //
analyzed: tha mi dad tha dad gnas 'gyur //
translated: Nondifference would be different.

original: tha dad dngos po med rtogs na //
analyzed: tha dad dngos po med rtogs na //
translated: If you realize difference as nonentity,

original: tha mi dad nyid ga las yin //
analyzed: tha mi dad nyid ga las yin //
translated: how could there be nondifference?

original: gal te tha dad pa yod na tha dad pa las gzhan tha mi dad pa nyid yod do zhes rtogs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te tha dad pa yod na tha dad pa las gzhan tha mi dad pa nyid yod do zhes rtogs par 'gyur la /
translated: If difference exists, then nondifference, which is different from difference, would exist.

original: de lta na yang dngos po med pa dang dngos po yang rtogs pas na /
analyzed: de lta na yang dngos po med pa dang dngos po yang rtogs pas na /
translated: Thus, since one understands both the existent and the nonexistent,

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyis su rtogs par 'gyur na /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyis su rtogs par 'gyur na /
translated: one would understand both existence and nonexistence.üîΩHow could that be nondual?

original: de ci ltar gnyis med par 'gyur /
analyzed: de ci ltar gnyis med par 'gyur /
translated: In this way:

original: 'di ltar / bum pa 'di la ka ba ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar / bum pa 'di la ka ba ni //
translated: ‚ÄúA pillar does not exist in this pot‚Äù

original: @269a * // med ces smin par dgag pa ni //
analyzed: @269a * // med ces smin par dgag pa ni //
translated: is a negative determination.

original: yod min med na med pa can //
analyzed: yod min med na med pa can //
translated: If it does not exist, it is not nonexistent.

original: tha dad rig pa nyid 'ongs so //
analyzed: tha dad rig pa nyid 'ongs so //
translated: The cognition of difference itself arises.

original: dgag pa thams cad ni tha dad med na mi 'byung ba can yin pas de la dgag pa rtogs na ji ltar tha mi dad par rtogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: dgag pa thams cad ni tha dad med na mi 'byung ba can yin pas de la dgag pa rtogs na ji ltar tha mi dad par rtogs par 'gyur /
translated: Since all negations are not possible without difference, how could one understand nondifference when one understands the negation?

original: dgag pa ma rtogs na ni ji lta ba bzhin du gnang ba'i phyir cung zad kyang rtogs par ma byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dgag pa ma rtogs na ni ji lta ba bzhin du gnang ba'i phyir cung zad kyang rtogs par ma byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does not understand the negation, one does not understand anything at all, since one does not understand things as they are.

original: gzhan rtogs par byed pa las gzhan khas blang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir na ci ltar gnyis med pa yin /
analyzed: gzhan rtogs par byed pa las gzhan khas blang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir na ci ltar gnyis med pa yin /
translated: Since it is to be accepted as something other than that which causes understanding, how could it be nondual?

original: bdag nyid kho na rtogs par byed pa ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: bdag nyid kho na rtogs par byed pa ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: There is no one at all who causes understanding of himself.

original: 'on te gzhan 'ga' yang rtogs par mi byed na /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan 'ga' yang rtogs par mi byed na /
translated: But if it does not cognize anything else,

original: de lta na ni bdag nyid rmongs pa yin pas ji ltar gnyis med par rtogs par byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta na ni bdag nyid rmongs pa yin pas ji ltar gnyis med par rtogs par byed par 'gyur /
translated: then it is itself deluded, and how can it cognize the nonexistence of duality?

original: rmongs pa bsal ban gzhan nyid skyes pa'i phyir gnyis med pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: rmongs pa bsal ban gzhan nyid skyes pa'i phyir gnyis med pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: And if it is produced from the removal of delusion, it is not nondual.

original: snga ma dang phyi ma yang ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma yang ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: And how can the prior and subsequent moments be cognized?

original: des na 'di ni gyi na'o zhe na /
analyzed: des na 'di ni gyi na'o zhe na /
translated: Therefore, this is mere prattle.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we reply:

original: gang gis de ltar bsgrubs bas ni //
analyzed: gang gis de ltar bsgrubs bas ni //
translated: By establishing it in this way,

original: tha dad ces bya 'di mthong med //üîΩde la dngos dang dngos med sogs //
analyzed: tha dad ces bya 'di mthong med // de la dngos dang dngos med sogs //
translated: the so-called difference is not seen.üîΩIn that case, the cognition of entity and nonentity, etc.,

original: rtogs pa 'di ni 'brel med 'gyur //üîΩre zhig snga ma dang phyi ma tha dad pa 'di ni snang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rtogs pa 'di ni 'brel med 'gyur // re zhig snga ma dang phyi ma tha dad pa 'di ni snang ba ma yin te /
translated: would be unrelated.

original: snga ma dang phyi ma la yang mngon sum mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgang la snga ma mngon sum yin na de nyid kyi tshe na snga ma da ltar ba nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma la yang mngon sum mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro // gang la snga ma mngon sum yin na de nyid kyi tshe na snga ma da ltar ba nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: First, this difference between prior and subsequent moments is not evident, because direct perception does not engage prior and subsequent moments.

original: gnyis pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa bzhin no //
translated: If the prior moment is direct perception, then at that time the prior moment would be present, like the second moment.

original: de'i da ltar ba nyid ni 'di kho na yin te /
analyzed: de'i da ltar ba nyid ni 'di kho na yin te /
translated: It is only the present that is directly perceived.

original: gang zhig mngon sum du byed pa'i rang bzhin gyis mngon sum la snang ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig mngon sum du byed pa'i rang bzhin gyis mngon sum la snang ba'o //
translated: It is directly perceived by the nature of the direct perception that appears.

analyzed: 'on te mi snang ngo zhes brjod na /

original: ci ltar 'das pa la sogs pa rig pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar 'das pa la sogs pa rig pa ma yin no zhe na /

original: re zhig skye ba 'di la ni //
analyzed: re zhig skye ba 'di la ni //

analyzed: 'ga' yang dmigs pa yod ma yin // de yi gnas skabs thob rnams la //

original: ji ltar 'gyur ba mi shes so //
analyzed: ji ltar 'gyur ba mi shes so //

analyzed: gang du mthong bar 'dod pa rnams kyang bkag ba der ma 'ongs pa la gus par ji ltar 'gyur /

analyzed: rmi lam bden pa mthong bas 'di nyid du yang 'das pa la sogs pa rig pa nyid do zhe na ma yin te /

original: mi dmigs pa'i gnas skabs na sad pa rnams /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i gnas skabs na sad pa rnams /
translated: For those who are awake in the state of nonapprehension

original: de ltar tha snyad du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar tha snyad du byed pa'i phyir ro //

original: de'i phyir 'das pa mngon sum gyis mi mthong zhing ma 'ongs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'das pa mngon sum gyis mi mthong zhing ma 'ongs pa yang ma yin no //

analyzed: des na ji ltar de @269b las tha dad par rtogs par 'gyur /

original: 'das pa la ni dran pa nyid yin na de yang tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: 'das pa la ni dran pa nyid yin na de yang tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: If it is memory itself with regard to the past, that is not a valid cognition.

original: 'o na te bstan pa la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: 'o na te bstan pa la sogs pa'am /
translated: But if it is through inference, because the teaching, etc.

original: rgyu rtogs pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pas yin te /üîΩdes na tha dad par rtogs par 'gyur ro zhe na yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu rtogs pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pas yin te / des na tha dad par rtogs par 'gyur ro zhe na yang ma yin te /
translated: is understood as the cause, then it is understood as different.

original: gang gi phyir /üîΩde dang 'brel pa rig pa las ;
analyzed: gang gi phyir / de dang 'brel pa rig pa las ;
translated: But that is not so, becauseüîΩthe cognition of the object to be inferred

original: /'byung bar 'gyur don rjes su dpog / rgyu dang brtan pa nyid dag la //
analyzed: /'byung bar 'gyur don rjes su dpog / rgyu dang brtan pa nyid dag la //

original: mngon sum gyis ni rig pa med //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis ni rig pa med //

original: gal te 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i don dang brtan pa'am rgyu dag 'brel par bzung na ni de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i don dang brtan pa'am rgyu dag 'brel par bzung na ni de'i tshe /
translated: If the object to be inferred and the invariable concomitance or the cause are apprehended as connected, then at that time

analyzed: rjes su dpag par rig pa yin no //

analyzed: 'brel pa las lkog tu gyur pa'i don rtogs pa ni rjes su dpog pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag par smra ba'i yin no //

analyzed: 'on te mthong ba'i phyir 'brel pa gzung ba med pa kho nar rjes su dpag pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the inference is the apprehension of the connection without seeing it,

original: 'o na ni ha cang thal ba nyid du thal lo //
analyzed: 'o na ni ha cang thal ba nyid du thal lo //
translated: then it follows, absurdly, that there is too much of everything.

original: ma mthong ba nyid kyi phyir mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma mthong ba nyid kyi phyir mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not so because it is not seen.

original: mthong ba nyid dang cig shos ni gcig tu bya bar mi nus so zhe na /üîΩgal te mthong ba'i phyir zhes lan 'debs na mthong ba de nyid mngon sum mam /
analyzed: mthong ba nyid dang cig shos ni gcig tu bya bar mi nus so zhe na / gal te mthong ba'i phyir zhes lan 'debs na mthong ba de nyid mngon sum mam /

original: rjes su dpag pas yin zhes bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas yin zhes bsam par bya'o //
translated: If you answer that it is because it is seen, then you must consider whether that seeing is by direct perception or by inference.

original: gal te rjes su dpag pas so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag pas so zhe na /

analyzed: rjes su dpag par de nyid bsam par bya ba yin pas ji ltar des yin /

original: 'on te mngon sum gyis yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te mngon sum gyis yin no zhe na /

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /

original: mngon sum gyis ni rjes su dpag pa mthong bar mi nus so //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis ni rjes su dpag pa mthong bar mi nus so //

original: de ni lkog tu gyur pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir dang / lkog tu gyur pa la yang mngon sum mi 'jug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni lkog tu gyur pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir dang / lkog tu gyur pa la yang mngon sum mi 'jug pa'i phyir /
translated: because it has an object that is hidden, and direct perception does not engage a hidden object.

original: ji ltar lkog tu gyur pa'i yul can nyid kyis rjes su dpag pa bdag gir byed /
analyzed: ji ltar lkog tu gyur pa'i yul can nyid kyis rjes su dpag pa bdag gir byed /

original: lkog tu gyur pa'i yul du mi byed pas ni yul de'i khyad par can gyi rjes su dpog pa rtogs par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa'i yul du mi byed pas ni yul de'i khyad par can gyi rjes su dpog pa rtogs par nus pa ma yin no //

original: 'on te de'i yul can nyid du mi 'dzin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te de'i yul can nyid du mi 'dzin no zhe na /
translated: But if it does not apprehend it as having that as its object,

original: de ltar yin na ni rjes su dpag pa ma mthong ba kho na yin pas ji ltar mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba gtan tshigs yin /
analyzed: de ltar yin na ni rjes su dpag pa ma mthong ba kho na yin pas ji ltar mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba gtan tshigs yin /

original: rang gi ngo bo rig pa tsam zhig rjes su dpag pa yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo rig pa tsam zhig rjes su dpag pa yin par 'gyur te /
translated: It would be an inference that is only the awareness of its own nature,

original: rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis de ltar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis de ltar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is seen in that way by the direct perception of reflexive awareness.

original: 'on te de kho na ltar tha snyad byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te de kho na ltar tha snyad byed pa yin no zhe na /

analyzed: de ltar yin na tha snyad tsam du 'gyur bas tha dad pa la mngon par zhen pas ci bya / tha dad par mngon par zhen pa yang mthong ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhe na mthong ba spang bar mi @270a * //
translated: If that is so, then since it would be mere convention, what is the use of the adherence to difference?üîΩBut it is seen that there is adherence to difference!

original: nus sam ci /
analyzed: nus sam ci /
translated: Is it impossible to abandon what is seen?

original: de ltar ro zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar ro zhe na /
translated: If it is so,

original: mthong ba nyid kyis rmongs pa thams cad spang bar mi nus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mthong ba nyid kyis rmongs pa thams cad spang bar mi nus pa'i phyir /
translated: then it is impossible to abandon all delusion by means of seeing.

original: khyed kyi nye bar bstan pa la brtson pa ni don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyed kyi nye bar bstan pa la brtson pa ni don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, your effort to teach would be pointless.

original: khyed kyi yang don med do zhe na ma yin te /üîΩma mthong ba la mthong bar rlom pa srid pas de lta bu brjod pa'i don du yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyed kyi yang don med do zhe na ma yin te / ma mthong ba la mthong bar rlom pa srid pas de lta bu brjod pa'i don du yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But if you say that your effort is not pointless,üîΩit is because it is possible that one might imagine that one has seen what one has not seen, and so it is for that purpose that you teach.

original: de lta yin dang / khyed tha dad par mngon par mthong ba med par tha dad par mngon par zhen par rlom pa'i phyir de ni do rab kho nar rigs so //
analyzed: de lta yin dang / khyed tha dad par mngon par mthong ba med par tha dad par mngon par zhen par rlom pa'i phyir de ni do rab kho nar rigs so //
translated: If that is so, then it is quite reasonable that you should imagine that you see difference without seeing difference.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / cha med da ltar snang ba yi //
analyzed: 'di ltar / cha med da ltar snang ba yi //

analyzed: tha dad pa la brten ma yin //

analyzed: snga ma phyi ma'i rtogs pa yang //

analyzed: so sor tha dad 'dzin pa min //
translated: are not apprehended as different.

original: bu ram dong gra'i 'bras bu bzhin //
analyzed: bu ram dong gra'i 'bras bu bzhin //

original: 'dus las de ltar 'gyur zhe na //
analyzed: 'dus las de ltar 'gyur zhe na //

analyzed: 'dir ni snga ma phyi ma nyid //

analyzed: sems la 'bras bu cung zad med //

analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i rnam rig ni //

analyzed: dran yin de ni myong las byung //

analyzed: 'dir ni rang gi don tsam rtogs pa'i rang bzhin snga ma dang phyi ma'i sems dag la 'bras bu gzhan cung zad kyang med do //

analyzed: gzhan yang / tha dad 'dzin par byed pa ni //
translated: Moreover,

original: dran pa nyid ces 'dod yin gyi //
analyzed: dran pa nyid ces 'dod yin gyi //
translated: Memory is asserted to apprehend the different,

original: nyams myong min phyir tha dad du //
analyzed: nyams myong min phyir tha dad du //
translated: But since it is not an experience, the difference

original: rig pa 'di ni kun rdzob nyid //
analyzed: rig pa 'di ni kun rdzob nyid //

original: 'di ltar / bsgyur dang ma bsgyur snang ba la //
analyzed: 'di ltar / bsgyur dang ma bsgyur snang ba la //

analyzed: snang ba tsam gyis sna tshogs dang // sna tshogs min nyid rnam 'byed min //

analyzed: des na rnam 'byed 'di dag kun //
translated: Therefore, all these differentiations

analyzed: snga ma'i rjes su 'brangs pa yin //
translated: are in accord with the former.

original: 'o na ni dran pa goms pa las gsal bar 'gyur ba'i mngon sum gyis tha dad pa 'dzin pa yin no zhe na /üîΩgang zhig mngon sum gyis ma grub //
analyzed: 'o na ni dran pa goms pa las gsal bar 'gyur ba'i mngon sum gyis tha dad pa 'dzin pa yin no zhe na / gang zhig mngon sum gyis ma grub //
translated: Now, if it is claimed that a clear perception arises from the cultivation of memory, and that it apprehends difference,üîΩthen how can that which is not established by perception

original: de ni goms las ji ltar yin //
analyzed: de ni goms las ji ltar yin //
translated: be established by cultivation?

original: goms pa las kyang mthong ba de //
analyzed: goms pa las kyang mthong ba de //

original: cig car du ni snang ba yin //
analyzed: cig car du ni snang ba yin //
translated: appears all at once.

original: der yang rnam par dbye ba de //
analyzed: der yang rnam par dbye ba de //
translated: And there, too, that differentiation

original: dran pa nyid kyis byas par 'dod //
analyzed: dran pa nyid kyis byas par 'dod //
translated: is said to be made by memory itself.

original: de ltar nyams myong la snang ba //
analyzed: de ltar nyams myong la snang ba //
translated: Thus, in experience,

analyzed: gang du'ang tha dad grub pa med //
translated: there is no establishment of difference anywhere.üîΩIf memory and the experience of the object

original: gal te dran la dran pa dang // nyams myong yan 'gar ba myong na //
analyzed: gal te dran la dran pa dang // nyams myong yan 'gar ba myong na //
translated: were separate,

analyzed: du ma'i rang bzhin de yang ni //

analyzed: phan tshun rnam dbye yod ma yin //

analyzed: rnam dbye nus pa min phyir ro // logs su gcod par mi nus shing //
translated: If it is not possible to distinguish it,üîΩAnd if it is not possible to view it as different,

original: gzhan du lta bar mi nus gang //üîΩblang dang dor nyid byas nyid phyir //
analyzed: gzhan du lta bar mi nus gang // blang dang dor nyid byas nyid phyir //

original: tha dad na yang des ci bya //
analyzed: tha dad na yang des ci bya //

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /

original: tha dad smra ba brtsams nas ni //
analyzed: tha dad smra ba brtsams nas ni //
translated: Having begun by propounding difference,

original: dran pa gzhan du brjod pa yin //üîΩthams cad rgyu dang ngo bo yin //
analyzed: dran pa gzhan du brjod pa yin // thams cad rgyu dang ngo bo yin //

original: dbye bas tha dad pa nyid yin //
analyzed: dbye bas tha dad pa nyid yin //

original: tha dad par smra ba'i ltar na ni rgyu tha dad pas rang gi @271a * //
analyzed: tha dad par smra ba'i ltar na ni rgyu tha dad pas rang gi @271a * //
translated: According to those who advocate difference, the cause is different from the effect.üîΩ

original: ngo bo tha dad pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: ngo bo tha dad pa'i phyir na /
translated: According to the theory of difference, the cause is different, and because of the difference of their own natures,

original: thams cad tha dad pa kho na'o //
analyzed: thams cad tha dad pa kho na'o //
translated: everything is only different.

original: de la dran pa ni bag chags tsam las skyes pa yin la /
analyzed: de la dran pa ni bag chags tsam las skyes pa yin la /
translated: In this regard, memory arises from mere habitual tendencies,

original: dbang po'i shes pa ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: but the sense consciousnesses do not.

original: dran pa ni lkog tu gyur ba'i yul can yin gyi dbang po las skyes pa'i rig pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dran pa ni lkog tu gyur ba'i yul can yin gyi dbang po las skyes pa'i rig pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Memory is a subject that has an obscure object, but the awareness that arises from the sense faculties is not.

original: des na 'di dag ni ka ba la sogs pa'i ltar tha dad pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: des na 'di dag ni ka ba la sogs pa'i ltar tha dad pa'i phyir na /
translated: Therefore, these are different, like a pillar and so on.

original: phyi'i don du smra ba rang gi khas len pas rtogs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: phyi'i don du smra ba rang gi khas len pas rtogs par byed pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the proponents of external objects understand this through their own assertions.

original: tha dad pa med par smra ba la ni rnam par dbye ba 'di ga la yod de rgyu dang ldan pa nyid ni rig par med de /
analyzed: tha dad pa med par smra ba la ni rnam par dbye ba 'di ga la yod de rgyu dang ldan pa nyid ni rig par med de /
translated: But how can this distinction exist for the proponents of nondifference? The mere possession of a cause is not a cognition,

original: mngon sum gyis de mi 'dzin phyir //üîΩrjes su dpag pa'ang mngon sum ni //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis de mi 'dzin phyir // rjes su dpag pa'ang mngon sum ni //
translated: because direct perception does not apprehend it.üîΩAlso, inference does not engage

original: med na 'jug par 'gyur ba min //
analyzed: med na 'jug par 'gyur ba min //
translated: without direct perception.

original: mngon sum gyis ni snga ma dang // phyi ma'i dngos po gnyis 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis ni snga ma dang // phyi ma'i dngos po gnyis 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: The present cognition does not grasp the two things, the prior and the subsequent.

original: 'bras bur 'dod pa 'dzin pa'i dus su ni /
analyzed: 'bras bur 'dod pa 'dzin pa'i dus su ni /
translated: When the effect is being apprehended,

original: rgyur mngon par 'dod pa dran pa tsam du zad la /
analyzed: rgyur mngon par 'dod pa dran pa tsam du zad la /
translated: the cause is merely remembered.üîΩWhen the cause is being apprehended, the effect is merely remembered.üîΩWhen the effect is being apprehended, the cause is not being apprehended.

original: gang gi tshe ni rang gi ngo bo kho nar 'dzin gyi 'bras bur ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe ni rang gi ngo bo kho nar 'dzin gyi 'bras bur ni ma yin no //
translated: When the cause is being apprehended, the effect is not being apprehended.

original: 'bras bu 'dzin pa'i dus na yang 'das pas dran pa tsam gyi spyod yul yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'dzin pa'i dus na yang 'das pas dran pa tsam gyi spyod yul yin no //
translated: When the effect is being apprehended, the cause is past and is the object of memory.

original: nyams su ma myong ba dran pa ma yin la /
analyzed: nyams su ma myong ba dran pa ma yin la /
translated: One does not remember what one has not experienced.

original: rgyu nyid nyams su myong ba yang med pas ji ltar dran par 'gyur /
analyzed: rgyu nyid nyams su myong ba yang med pas ji ltar dran par 'gyur /
translated: Since the cause itself is not experienced, how can it be remembered?

original: 'on te 'bras bu'i dus su yang de nyams su myong ba mi srid pa'i phyir dus mtshungs pa yin pas rnam par dbye bar mi nus pa'i phyir tha mi dad pa nyid yin na /

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por ga la 'gyur /
translated: how can there be a relation of cause and effect?

original: 'on te 'di ni sngar yang yan 'gar du nyams su myong bar 'gyur te zhes dran pas rnam par 'jog go //
analyzed: 'on te 'di ni sngar yang yan 'gar du nyams su myong bar 'gyur te zhes dran pas rnam par 'jog go //
translated: Or else, it is memory that determines it, saying: ‚ÄúI have already experienced this many times.‚ÄùüîΩThus, since it is divisible, it is different.

original: des na rnam par dbyer yod pas tha dad pa nyid do zhe na ci ste dran pa de ci zhig rjes su dpag pa yin nam /üîΩ'on te dran pa tsam yin /
analyzed: des na rnam par dbyer yod pas tha dad pa nyid do zhe na ci ste dran pa de ci zhig rjes su dpag pa yin nam / 'on te dran pa tsam yin /

original: re zhig gal te rjes su dpag pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: re zhig gal te rjes su dpag pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is inference,

original: ci ltar mngon sum med par 'gyur /
analyzed: ci ltar mngon sum med par 'gyur /
translated: how can there be perception?

original: mngon sum gyis ni sngar snga ma nyid du gzung ba med do //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis ni sngar snga ma nyid du gzung ba med do //
translated: It is not that perception has previously apprehended the object as being the same.

original: mngon sum thams cad ni da ltar ba 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum thams cad ni da ltar ba 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: For all perception apprehends the present.

original: 'o na mngon sum gyis dus nges pa nyid gzhan dang ma 'dres par bzung ba gang yin pa de nyid bzung ba phyi ma la ltos nas snga ma zhes tha snyad byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na mngon sum gyis dus nges pa nyid gzhan dang ma 'dres par bzung ba gang yin pa de nyid bzung ba phyi ma la ltos nas snga ma zhes tha snyad byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But the perception that determines the time of the object as being unmixed with another is that very perception that apprehends it. Later, in dependence on that, it is designated as ‚Äúprior.‚Äù

original: de yang ma yin te /üîΩgzhan la ltos nas snga ma yi //
analyzed: de yang ma yin te / gzhan la ltos nas snga ma yi //
translated: That is not so.üîΩThe prior perception

original: mngon sum 'jug par 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: mngon sum 'jug par 'gyur ba yin //
translated: is engaged in dependence on another.

original: de phyir nges ni snga ma nyid //
analyzed: de phyir nges ni snga ma nyid //
translated: Therefore, the former is ascertained.

original: mi 'dzin rang bdag la gnas phyir //
analyzed: mi 'dzin rang bdag la gnas phyir //
translated: Because it does not grasp, it is not established as a self.

original: rang gi dus kyi rang gi ngo bo 'dzin pa'i mngon sum snga ma gzhan la ltos pa'i bdag @271b nyid ji ltar 'dzin par 'gyur /
analyzed: rang gi dus kyi rang gi ngo bo 'dzin pa'i mngon sum snga ma gzhan la ltos pa'i bdag @271b nyid ji ltar 'dzin par 'gyur /
translated: How could the former direct perception, which grasps its own entity at its own time, grasp the nature that depends on another?

original: mngon sum phyi ma yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: mngon sum phyi ma yang de bzhin no //
translated: The latter direct perception is also like that.

original: des na snga ma dang phyi ma la ltos pa 'di ni snga ma dang phyi ma'i mngon sum gyis gzung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: des na snga ma dang phyi ma la ltos pa 'di ni snga ma dang phyi ma'i mngon sum gyis gzung ba ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, this dependence on the former and latter is not grasped by the former and latter direct perceptions.

original: des na de la dran pa yang ji ltar 'jug par 'gyur //
analyzed: des na de la dran pa yang ji ltar 'jug par 'gyur //
translated: Therefore, how could memory also engage with that?

original: des na ltos pa ni mngon sum dang / dran pas kyang rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na ltos pa ni mngon sum dang / dran pas kyang rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, dependence is not understood by direct perception or memory.

original: de'i phyir rigs pa ma yin pa la gang las rjes su dpag pa 'jug /'on te dran pa tsam yin na /
analyzed: de'i phyir rigs pa ma yin pa la gang las rjes su dpag pa 'jug /'on te dran pa tsam yin na /
translated: Therefore, how could inference engage with that which is illogical? But if it is mere memory,

original: de ni tshad ma ma yin pas gang gis snga ma phyi ma la ltos pa'i 'bras bu rig par 'gyur ba de las rtogs par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de ni tshad ma ma yin pas gang gis snga ma phyi ma la ltos pa'i 'bras bu rig par 'gyur ba de las rtogs par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: since that is not valid cognition, how could it understand that by which the result that depends on the former and latter is known?

original: 'on te tshogs pa'i stobs las de nyid 'di yin no snyam du shes pas gcig nyid du gzung ba yin te /
analyzed: 'on te tshogs pa'i stobs las de nyid 'di yin no snyam du shes pas gcig nyid du gzung ba yin te /
translated: But if it is the power of the collection that is the cause of the cognition ‚ÄúThat is this,‚Äù then the object is apprehended as one.

original: des na rnam par 'byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des na rnam par 'byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it is analyzed.

original: de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya ba yang dran pa dang nyams su myong ba'i rang bzhin gyi shes pa gnyis yin no //üîΩdes na / gang gis gcig nyid 'dzin par 'gyur /
analyzed: de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya ba yang dran pa dang nyams su myong ba'i rang bzhin gyi shes pa gnyis yin no // des na / gang gis gcig nyid 'dzin par 'gyur /
translated: ‚ÄúThat is this‚Äù is a cognition that has the nature of memory and experience.üîΩBy what is it apprehended as one?

original: 'dzin pa mthong ngo zhe na /
analyzed: 'dzin pa mthong ngo zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is apprehended by seeing,

original: 'dzin pa mthong ba ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dzin pa mthong ba ni ma yin gyi /
translated: it is not seen by seeing.

original: 'dzin ba dran pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dzin ba dran pa yin no //
translated: It is remembered by memory.

original: 'o na dran par bya ba dang / mthong bar bya ba dang / snam bu dang / shing rta bzhin du ji ltar ma rtogs she na /
analyzed: 'o na dran par bya ba dang / mthong bar bya ba dang / snam bu dang / shing rta bzhin du ji ltar ma rtogs she na /
translated: But how is it not understood as it is, that is, as something to be remembered and something to be seen, like a cloth and a chariot?

original: gal te rnam par brtags na ni /
analyzed: gal te rnam par brtags na ni /
translated: If it is analyzed,

original: de lta bu kho nar rtogs so //
analyzed: de lta bu kho nar rtogs so //
translated: it is understood in just that way.

original: dran pa dang mngon sum gyi rnam pa dag ni gcig tu rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dran pa dang mngon sum gyi rnam pa dag ni gcig tu rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: The aspects of memory and direct perception are not understood as one.

original: de ltar yin na ni /
analyzed: de ltar yin na ni /
translated: If that were so,

original: de dag nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag nyid du mi 'gyur ro //

original: de ltar yin dang / snga ma dang phyi ma dag ni gcig tu rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yin dang / snga ma dang phyi ma dag ni gcig tu rtogs pa ma yin no //

analyzed: dran pa'i rnam pas ni rtogs pa'i don snga ma yin no zhes bya bar mi nus la /

analyzed: mngon sum du byas na ni da ltar ba nyid du 'gyur gyi snga ma la ni ma yin no zhes bya bar rigs so //

analyzed: 'on te tha snyad 'dogs pa'i phyir gcig nyid do zhe na /

original: 'dis ni mun khung du gar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni mun khung du gar byed pa yin no //

original: don gzhan nam cig shos ni /
analyzed: don gzhan nam cig shos ni /

analyzed: rtogs par sgrub par byed pa yin //

analyzed: rtogs pas sgrub pa ma yin pa //

analyzed: cig tha snyad tshad ma yin nam /

analyzed: sgrub par byed pa ma yin no zhes bstan zin to //

analyzed: de ste tshad ma ma yin na de las ji ltar tha dad pa grub ces smos shig / tha dad pa med na 'o na ji ltar tha snyad du 'gyur zhe na /

analyzed: 'di ni tha dad pa la yang mtshungs so // shes @272a * //

analyzed: 'dir smras pa /

analyzed: shes na ci'i phyir 'jug par byed //

analyzed: reg pa la sogs sngar mthong phyir //

analyzed: 'o na ci phyir 'jug par byed //

analyzed: 'jug pa mthong nyid ce na ci //

analyzed: ci ltar mthong ba med pa de ltar yang bstan zin pa nyid do //

analyzed: 'o na @272b ji ltar dngos po rgyu med par yod ce na / khyed kyis dngos po gang zhig 'dir //
translated: But how can things exist without a cause?üîΩYou have not understood

analyzed: rgyu las yod par rtogs pa yin // rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni //

original: de la rig pa ni 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la rig pa ni 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In this case, knowledge is past.

original: mngon par rlom pa ni brjod na 'gyur ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: mngon par rlom pa ni brjod na 'gyur ba yin zhe na /
translated: If it is said that the conceit is the expression,

original: brjod pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig phyin ci log tu sgro 'dogs pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: brjod pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig phyin ci log tu sgro 'dogs pa'o zhe na /
translated: what is this so-called expression? It is the superimposition of error.

original: 'di la yang mtshungs so //üîΩ'du byed tha dad pa'o zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di la yang mtshungs so // 'du byed tha dad pa'o zhe na ma yin te /
translated: This is the same in this case.

original: 'du byed med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'du byed med pa'i phyir //
translated: If it is said that it is the difference in the formations, no, because the formations do not exist.

original: 'du byed pa ni snga na med par zad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'du byed pa ni snga na med par zad pa ma yin no //
translated: The formations are not prior to the nonexistence of the self.üîΩThe formations are not prior to the nonexistence of the self.

original: bden pa ni zad par bya mi nus so zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: bden pa ni zad par bya mi nus so zhes bstan zin to //
translated: It has already been shown that the truth cannot be exhausted.

original: gal te 'du byed pa zad pa phyin ci log tu sgro 'dogs pa'i rgyu yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'du byed pa zad pa phyin ci log tu sgro 'dogs pa'i rgyu yin na /
translated: If the exhaustion of conditioning were the cause of the superimposition of error,

original: tha dad par sgro 'dogs pa dang / rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldeg par sgro 'dogs pa la yang de ltar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: tha dad par sgro 'dogs pa dang / rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldeg par sgro 'dogs pa la yang de ltar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: then the same would be true of the superimposition of difference, of following, and of reversing.

original: 'di la 'gal ba ci yod /
analyzed: 'di la 'gal ba ci yod /
translated: What contradiction is there in this?

original: mngon par rlom pa las ma gtogs pa don dam par ni rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa rtogs pa med do //
analyzed: mngon par rlom pa las ma gtogs pa don dam par ni rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa rtogs pa med do //
translated: Apart from the superimposition, there is no ultimate realization of following and reversing.

original: mtha' dag ni mngon par rlom pa tsam du tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: mtha' dag ni mngon par rlom pa tsam du tha dad pa yin no //
translated: The whole is only different in the superimposition.

original: de'i phyir snga ma dang phyi ma dag rnam par dben par gzung yang gcig tu khas blang bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir snga ma dang phyi ma dag rnam par dben par gzung yang gcig tu khas blang bar bya ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, even if the prior and subsequent are apprehended as isolated, they must be accepted as one.

original: de lta ma yin na shes pa tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na shes pa tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would be mere consciousness.

original: de khas blang bar nus pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de khas blang bar nus pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And that cannot be accepted,

original: gang gi phyir /üîΩtha dad can ni rnam gsal ba //
analyzed: gang gi phyir / tha dad can ni rnam gsal ba //
translated: becauseüîΩThe different is clearly manifest.

original: tha dad med pa gzhan mthong med //
analyzed: tha dad med pa gzhan mthong med //
translated: The non-different is not seen elsewhere.

original: ma mthong ba ni yod do zhes khas blang bar nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma mthong ba ni yod do zhes khas blang bar nus pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not possible to accept that what is not seen exists.

original: de med par ni tha dad pa'i yan lag rnams tha dad pa med pa'i yan lag can gyi yin no zhes bstan par nus pa ma yin na /
analyzed: de med par ni tha dad pa'i yan lag rnams tha dad pa med pa'i yan lag can gyi yin no zhes bstan par nus pa ma yin na /
translated: And it is not possible to show that the separate parts are the possessor of the separate parts, when the possessor does not exist.

original: de'i phyir phyi rol gyi don khas len pas cig car nyid du 'dzin pa nyid khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyi rol gyi don khas len pas cig car nyid du 'dzin pa nyid khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, because of accepting external objects, one must accept that they are apprehended simultaneously.

original: gal te du ma gcig gis ji ltar 'dzin te /
analyzed: gal te du ma gcig gis ji ltar 'dzin te /
translated: If many are apprehended by one, how is that?

original: gcig pa zhugs pa'i mthong ba gang yin pa nyid ni de nyid kyi tshe gzhan la 'jug par nus pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gcig pa zhugs pa'i mthong ba gang yin pa nyid ni de nyid kyi tshe gzhan la 'jug par nus pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: That which is the seeing of the engagement of one is not able to engage another at that time.

original: du ma mthong ba nyid yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes gang @274b bstan zin pa nyid do //
analyzed: du ma mthong ba nyid yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes gang @274b bstan zin pa nyid do //
translated: It has already been shown that it is the seeing of many, not of another.

original: don dam par ni rang rig pa gcig nyid de /
analyzed: don dam par ni rang rig pa gcig nyid de /
translated: In reality, there is only one consciousness that is self-aware.

original: gzhan gyis gzhan 'dzin pa ni mi srid do //
analyzed: gzhan gyis gzhan 'dzin pa ni mi srid do //
translated: It is impossible for one to apprehend another.

original: gzhan yang 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni 'ga' yang med kyi 'on kyang blo de'i rnam par bskyed pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni 'ga' yang med kyi 'on kyang blo de'i rnam par bskyed pa nyid do //
translated: Moreover, so-called apprehension does not exist at all, but it is the mere production of the aspect of that cognition.

original: du ma gcig gi skyed par byed pa ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: du ma gcig gi skyed par byed pa ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it that many are not the cause of one,üîΩbecause:

original: 'di ltar / gal te dbang po la sogs bzhin //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gal te dbang po la sogs bzhin //
translated: If, like the sense faculties, etc.,

original: khyad par skyes 'gyur mang po dag / cig car blo yi rgyur 'gyur yang //
analyzed: khyad par skyes 'gyur mang po dag / cig car blo yi rgyur 'gyur yang //
translated: many are the cause of the arising of one,

original: 'gal ba dag ni ci zhig yod //üîΩci ltar dbang po dang don dang yid la byed pa'am /
analyzed: 'gal ba dag ni ci zhig yod // ci ltar dbang po dang don dang yid la byed pa'am /
translated: what is the contradiction?üîΩJust as the sense faculty, object, and mental activity,

original: bdag dang dbang po dang / yid phrad pa las cig car dbang po'i rnam par shes pa de bzhin du gal te ;
analyzed: bdag dang dbang po dang / yid phrad pa las cig car dbang po'i rnam par shes pa de bzhin du gal te ;
translated: or the self, sense faculty, and mental activity, are the simultaneous cause of the sense consciousness,üîΩif the atoms are also like that, there is no contradiction.

original: rdul phra rab dag kyang yin na mi 'gal te rdul phra rab dag mi rtag pa nyid yin yang khyad par ci zhig yod /
analyzed: rdul phra rab dag kyang yin na mi 'gal te rdul phra rab dag mi rtag pa nyid yin yang khyad par ci zhig yod /
translated: Even though the atoms are impermanent, what is the difference?

original: lhan cig byed pa nyer zin kyang rdul phra rab dag ni chen por 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa nyer zin kyang rdul phra rab dag ni chen por 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Even though the cooperating causes are present, the atoms do not become larger.üîΩIf you say that they do not abandon their fineness,

original: phra mo nyid mi 'dor ro zhe na ni ltar bzung ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: phra mo nyid mi 'dor ro zhe na ni ltar bzung ba yin zhe na /
translated: then they are not apprehended as they are.

original: de yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang ma yin te /
translated: That is also not so,

original: 'dir ni chen po khyad par min //
analyzed: 'dir ni chen po khyad par min //
translated: because here largeness is not the difference.

original: khyad par de ni nus pa yin //
analyzed: khyad par de ni nus pa yin //
translated: That difference is the capacity.

original: nus pa med phyir rgyur mi 'gyur //
analyzed: nus pa med phyir rgyur mi 'gyur //
translated: It is not a cause because it is not a potentiality.

original: chen po min phyir 'dod ma yin //
analyzed: chen po min phyir 'dod ma yin //
translated: It is not a desire because it is not a great one.

original: gal te rang gi ngo bo'i rjes su byed pa'i blo skyed pa'i rdul phra rab dag bltar rung ba nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te rang gi ngo bo'i rjes su byed pa'i blo skyed pa'i rdul phra rab dag bltar rung ba nyid yin na /
translated: If the atoms which produce the cognition conforming to the nature of the object are visible,

original: de ni med pa'i phyir grub pa la sgrub pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ni med pa'i phyir grub pa la sgrub pa nyid do //
translated: then the proof is superfluous, since they exist.

original: 'on te rnam par shes pa tsam skyed pa yin na de ni yod pa kho na ste /
analyzed: 'on te rnam par shes pa tsam skyed pa yin na de ni yod pa kho na ste /
translated: If the atoms produce only a cognition, then they exist,

original: skra shad la sogs pa dag la mthong ba'i phyir 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: skra shad la sogs pa dag la mthong ba'i phyir 'gal ba med do //
translated: since one sees hairs, etc.

original: dper na yul thag ring por ma 'dres pa'i skra yang sbom po gcig tu snang ba bzhin du rdul phra rab dag kyang yin pa'i phyir 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: dper na yul thag ring por ma 'dres pa'i skra yang sbom po gcig tu snang ba bzhin du rdul phra rab dag kyang yin pa'i phyir 'gal ba med do //
translated: There is no contradiction, since the atoms are like a single thick hair which appears in the distance without being distinguished.

original: yan 'gar ba bzhin du phra mos de yang ci ltar skyed par byed ce na /
analyzed: yan 'gar ba bzhin du phra mos de yang ci ltar skyed par byed ce na /
translated: How can the subtle cause the effect, as the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas say?

original: yan 'gar ba rnams ni mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yan 'gar ba rnams ni mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas say that the atoms are not capable of producing the effect by their mere aggregation, because they are not capable individually.

original: nus pa med pa nyid rgyu'i dngos po 'gal gyi /
analyzed: nus pa med pa nyid rgyu'i dngos po 'gal gyi /
translated: The fact of not being capable is not incompatible with the nature of cause.

original: phra mo nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: phra mo nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: The fact of being subtle is not incompatible with the nature of cause.

original: skra shad nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: skra shad nyid bzhin no //
translated: like the hair of a tortoise.

original: tshogs pa'i gnas skabs na dbang po la sogs pa rnams la rags pa nyid kyi khyad par skye ba med pa de lta na yang nus pa'i khyad par nyid las skyed par byed pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: tshogs pa'i gnas skabs na dbang po la sogs pa rnams la rags pa nyid kyi khyad par skye ba med pa de lta na yang nus pa'i khyad par nyid las skyed par byed pa nyid yin no //
translated: Even though the difference of grossness does not arise in the sense faculties, etc., when they are in a collection, still, they are producers by reason of the difference of their power.

original: 'o na nye ba na gnas pa gzhan gyi nus pa de ci ltar mi mthong na ci ltar yod pa yin /
analyzed: 'o na nye ba na gnas pa gzhan gyi nus pa de ci ltar mi mthong na ci ltar yod pa yin /
translated: But if the power of the other, which is near, is not seen, how can it exist?

original: mtshungs pa nyid yin na de 'bras bu gcig skyed par byed kyi gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam par dbye bar yang ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /üîΩyul thag ring ba la sogs pa lhan cig @275a * //
analyzed: mtshungs pa nyid yin na de 'bras bu gcig skyed par byed kyi gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam par dbye bar yang ci ltar 'gyur zhe na / yul thag ring ba la sogs pa lhan cig @275a * //
translated: If it is the same, how can there be a distinction that it produces one effect and not another?üîΩThe distinction is due to the difference of the object, etc.,

original: byed pa'i rnam par dbye ba las so //
analyzed: byed pa'i rnam par dbye ba las so //
translated: of the co-operators.

original: gal te yul thag ring po nyid kyis kyang skra de nyid rnam par dbye bar gal 'gyur zhe na tshogs pa gzhan rjes su zhugs pa'i phyir ro zhes 'di ni dpyad zin to //
analyzed: gal te yul thag ring po nyid kyis kyang skra de nyid rnam par dbye bar gal 'gyur zhe na tshogs pa gzhan rjes su zhugs pa'i phyir ro zhes 'di ni dpyad zin to //
translated: If the distance of the object is also a distinction of the hair itself, how can it be a distinction? Because another collection is involved. This has been analyzed.

original: gal te rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'dzin na mig la sogs pa yang gzung ba nyid du thal te /
analyzed: gal te rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'dzin na mig la sogs pa yang gzung ba nyid du thal te /
translated: If you say that the object is apprehended because it is a cause, then it follows that the eye sense faculty, etc. are also apprehended,

original: rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because they are causes.

original: de'i phyir bshad pa /üîΩrgyu yi dngos po ma gtogs pa'i //
analyzed: de'i phyir bshad pa / rgyu yi dngos po ma gtogs pa'i //
translated: Therefore, it is said:üîΩApart from being a cause,

original: bzung ba zhes bya gzhan ci'ang med //
analyzed: bzung ba zhes bya gzhan ci'ang med //
translated: there is no other so-called object.

original: de la blo ni gang du snang //
analyzed: de la blo ni gang du snang //
translated: Where does the mind appear?

original: de ni de yi bzung bar brjod //
analyzed: de ni de yi bzung bar brjod //
translated: That is called its object.

original: gzugs kyi skye mched du mtshungs pas na de'i rnam pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye mched du mtshungs pas na de'i rnam pa yin gyi /
translated: Since it is similar to the form base, it has that aspect,

original: don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: but not ultimately.

original: 'di ltar sngon po'i rdul phra rab kyi tshogs las rnam par shes pa sngon po'i rnam pa nyid du 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sngon po'i rdul phra rab kyi tshogs las rnam par shes pa sngon po'i rnam pa nyid du 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: Thus, consciousness becomes the aspect of blue from a collection of blue atoms,

original: rdul phra rab kyi rnam pa nyid du ni 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rdul phra rab kyi rnam pa nyid du ni 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: but it does not become the aspect of atoms.

original: gal te rdul phra rab kyi rnam pa mi snang na sngon po'i rnam pa 'di rdul phra rab rnams kyi yin no zhes bya ba ga las yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rdul phra rab kyi rnam pa mi snang na sngon po'i rnam pa 'di rdul phra rab rnams kyi yin no zhes bya ba ga las yin zhe na /
translated: If the aspect of atoms does not appear, how can it be said that this aspect of blue is of the atoms?

original: gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i phyir de ltar skyon med do //
analyzed: gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i phyir de ltar skyon med do //
translated: But it is not tenable in any other way. Therefore, there is no fault.üîΩIf you do not apprehend a whole simultaneously, then there is another fault.

original: gal te ci car du ma mi 'dzin na de'i tshe skyon gzhan 'di yod do zhes gang bshad pa ni /üîΩji ltar rang gi yan lag bcas //
analyzed: gal te ci car du ma mi 'dzin na de'i tshe skyon gzhan 'di yod do zhes gang bshad pa ni / ji ltar rang gi yan lag bcas //
translated: As it is said,üîΩHow can you apprehend a whole

original: cig car yan lag can gzung yin //
analyzed: cig car yan lag can gzung yin //
translated: Simultaneously with its parts?

original: mi 'dzin pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: mi 'dzin pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: You do not apprehend it!

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, you do not.

original: lkog shal sogs mthong med par ni //
analyzed: lkog shal sogs mthong med par ni //
translated: You do not see a cow without seeing its dewlap and so on.

original: ba lang shes par mthong ba med //
analyzed: ba lang shes par mthong ba med //
translated: You do not see a whole without seeing its parts.

original: gal te yon tan gtso bo dag / cig car rtogs par 'dod na yang //
analyzed: gal te yon tan gtso bo dag / cig car rtogs par 'dod na yang //
translated: Even if you assert that you apprehend the whole and its qualities simultaneously,

original: cig car yan lag rdzogs 'dzin min //
analyzed: cig car yan lag rdzogs 'dzin min //
translated: you do not apprehend the whole simultaneously with its parts.

original: yon tan la sogs ldan pa'ang min //
analyzed: yon tan la sogs ldan pa'ang min //
translated: You do not apprehend the whole as possessing qualities and so on.

original: gang zhig khyad par nyid du 'dod pa'i cha de nyid du gzung ba'i phyir yan lag rdzogs par mi 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zhig khyad par nyid du 'dod pa'i cha de nyid du gzung ba'i phyir yan lag rdzogs par mi 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: You do not apprehend the whole as complete because you apprehend only the parts that you assert to be the whole.

original: de dag thams cad khyad par 'dod do zhe na /
analyzed: de dag thams cad khyad par 'dod do zhe na /
translated: If you assert that you apprehend all of the parts,

original: ma yin te ;üîΩkhyad par dang ni khyad par can //
analyzed: ma yin te ; khyad par dang ni khyad par can //
translated: you do not.üîΩBecause the whole and its parts

original: brjod par 'dod pa'i gzhan dbang phyir //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa'i gzhan dbang phyir //
translated: are dependent on the desire to express them.

original: yan lag nyid du 'gyur ba gang //
analyzed: yan lag nyid du 'gyur ba gang //
translated: What is a part?

original: de ni de nyid kyis 'dzin 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni de nyid kyis 'dzin 'gyur //
translated: It is that which is grasped by that.

original: khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po don dam pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po don dam pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The relation of qualifier and qualificand is not ultimate,

original: gzhan dag gam de nyid kyi gzhan gyi tshe /
analyzed: gzhan dag gam de nyid kyi gzhan gyi tshe /
translated: because at other times or at another,

original: khyad par nyid khyad par nyid khyad par can du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par nyid khyad par nyid khyad par can du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the qualifier itself is grasped as the qualificand.

original: 'di ltar rva can ba lang dang / ba lang rva can dang / ba lang dkar po /
analyzed: 'di ltar rva can ba lang dang / ba lang rva can dang / ba lang dkar po /
translated: For example, one sees various things, such as a cow with horns, a horned cow, a white cow,üîΩa round cow,

original: ba lang zlum po'am /
analyzed: ba lang zlum po'am /
translated: or a cow that is not square.üîΩBut one does not grasp all the qualifiers at one time,

original: gru bzhi ma yin no zhes rtogs pa sna tshogs par mthong gi dus gcig tu khyad par thams cad 'dzin pa ni ma yin te /üîΩci car du ma khyad par nyid du bzung bar mi nus pa'i @275b phyir ro //
analyzed: gru bzhi ma yin no zhes rtogs pa sna tshogs par mthong gi dus gcig tu khyad par thams cad 'dzin pa ni ma yin te / ci car du ma khyad par nyid du bzung bar mi nus pa'i @275b phyir ro //
translated: because one cannot grasp many things at once.

original: rnam par rtog pa med pas ni khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po 'dzin pa ma yin no //üîΩgzhan yang / rang gi dngos po gzhan dag las //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pas ni khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po 'dzin pa ma yin no // gzhan yang / rang gi dngos po gzhan dag las //
translated: And one does not grasp the relation of qualifier and qualificand without conceptualization.üîΩMoreover,

original: tha dad med phyir yon tan rdzogs //
analyzed: tha dad med phyir yon tan rdzogs //
translated: The perfection of the qualities is not different from the other things,üîΩbecause of the absence of difference.

original: tha dad byed pa'ang ma bzung phyir //
analyzed: tha dad byed pa'ang ma bzung phyir //
translated: Because it is not apprehended as a distinct agent.

original: gzhan gzhan mthong yang blo gcig 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan gzhan mthong yang blo gcig 'gyur //
translated: Even though the other is seen, the cognition is one.

original: ba lang rang nyid kyis ni ba lang ma yin la /
analyzed: ba lang rang nyid kyis ni ba lang ma yin la /
translated: A cow is not a non-cow by itself.
